We arrived, ready for some good beer and food.  First disappointment: Their reservation check in system. A chalkboard sign indicated a table for to-go order pick ups and simply an arrow for reservations. No employee to greet, direct or be helpful. 2 employees filling to go orders as we stood in what we estimated to be the 'reservation' line. Several people were behindus when 2 young women cut in front of us and said loudly "Will you take walk ins" and to our astonishment they got an employee's attention who completely ignored us and helped them get a table. Very rude!  Once we were checked in we found a table in the shade and went to get our beers and food. Disappointment #2: No food. Only popcorn and a cheese plate. That was it. We told them we had been assured over messenger that their kitchen was open and they shrugged and said  "Don't know what to tell you. It's being renovated."  I can't understand how they are allowed to stay open withbeer and POPCORN sales as food, under the Governor's new restriction.  At this point we already had our beer so we went back to the table to make the best of it.  Disappointment #3: the amount of flies and mosquitoes. We go out to another "farm style brewery" frequently and have never had an issue with flies or mosquitoes like we did here. Maybe it's one brewery using a spray service vs. not? Maybe it's dogpoop from being a dog friendly brewery (although, so is the other farm Brewery we go to...) We had 4 mosquito bites while sitting there and this was at 5:00. Flies were insane.  It was a disappointment all the way around as we had really been looking forward to several hours of relaxation, beer and food out under the trees.  Added on 7/11:  I have not changed a word of my original review, however I am adding a Star based upon the great communication I have had with one of the owners, Kent, who wrote to me after my original review.  He seemed genuinely interested in my feedback and responded in a very thorough manner.

reviews.author: Alena D.
reviews.description: My husband and I love vista brewing! The owners are so friendly, it's family friendly and they follow covid guidelines so we felt very safe. We love sitting indoors and outdoors depending on the weather and like that we have that option. They have live music on weekends and the beer/wine selection is good. Pre-covid their food was farm to table and delicious. We're anxiously awaiting the return on their standard food items. Definitely a great place to check out!

reviews.author: Anita C.
reviews.description: Come for the beer, don't stay for the food.   We came here for the first time and ordered a bunch of food and beer. The beers are good. The food is not. I didn't realize the current menu is because of covid. The sandwiches were all cold. The pimento cheese dip was good but hard because it's also cold. Literally everything came out of the fridge as they handed it to us.   It was a terrible first impression. I understand it's covid, but I think they could've at least heated the sandwiches or tried to make some better food that can be packaged.   Great venue. Not sure I'll come back.

reviews.author: Garnie B.
reviews.description: Had a school event there and it was great.  Plenty of seating in and out.  lots of room for the kids to run about and having a great staff about was wonderful.   only ding was the coordination / distribution of food.  Basically they ran out for our guests, and well, there is nothing you can do about it.   Events are hard to plan for, especially with family and kids, so we will work with them next time to better handle the food service / serving.   The beer was good, the wine selection was pretty good.   What i liked the most was the atmosphere. on a cool evening, with the stars out, it was a great place to be to unwind and chill with friends / family.    Plenty of parking..   Finding the place...well, thats tricky.  See punch in the address in Google Maps, you will be ok, just know that when you get close, slow down, and know the entrance is on top of a hill ... so you can miss it if you are not paying attention.   will I go back: of course, and I would recommend you go and visit.

reviews.author: Ed G.
reviews.description: Friday afternoon at the Vista Brewing pop-up at the galleria!  Perfect weather, perfect pour!  Check it out!

reviews.author: Alex V.
reviews.description: First time ever at Vista! Also first draft beer (not Crowley/growler) since beginning of lockdown. Such a great spot.   COVID: Vista has a GREAT outdoor area with plenty of tables distanced from one another. The ordering process specifies 6 ft of distance in line. Hand sanitizer is everywhere. Beers are delivered in single use cups. They have also started their live music Fridays again where you can venmo the artist tips. Masks are required everywhere but at your table.  You can make a reservation on Open Table for their outdoor area. Currently, they are open until 8PM.  We brought our own chairs and a blanket to use as a tablecloth. We also brought our own glasses to pour the beers into. I love beer out of a glass so this was a need for me.   Overall: This brewery has a ton of good stuff going for it. It's a little out of the way for Austinites (40 minutes), so you've got to make a night out of it. We're generally bigger IPA fans, so there are a few breweries we would check out ahead of this one. BUT they still have a ton of great beers on tap, and it is so worth checking out.

reviews.author: Olivia G.
reviews.description: I'm a big tequila and mezcal fan and I heard about Sotol which has a similar taste. Then I found out that Sotol is unique to Texas so I had to go try it.   The cocktails at this place are great! The most popular is their frozen margarita, you have to try it. If you really just want to get a feel for what Sotol tastes like though, try ordering the flight first.   For food, there is a food truck on the premises. I think they switch it up but when I went it was a Mexican food truck with very good Birria tacos.

reviews.author: Mahesh P.
reviews.description: This is their Sotol Tasting Room. Which may not seem all that great, but boy howdy, is it ever! They've got their sotol, of course, but also a whole bunch of (sotol and other) cocktails, food, and a pretty cool outdoor space with plenty of place to chill. Best of all, there's pretty much always some sort of musician doing their thing (this *is* Austin after all!)  If only it wasn't a decent drive away....

reviews.author: Rosario F.
reviews.description: My friend who knows all the hot spots invited me here during the stricter COVID times. It's a heck of a drive but I was really impressed with how lovely this place is. Very Instagramable location with the truck outside and the silo.   PARKING I went when it was pretty busy. I found parking but I did have to wait for like 5 minutes so cars could clear the road. It gets pretty tight once the parking spots are all full. It's all free. A lot of cars parked on the road. Just be careful crossing the road.   FOOD When I was here they only had one food truck. The options were limited. The prices were a bit too high for the food options available. I didn't try it out. My friends ordered a few things and they felt the food was just ok. I'm not sure on the current food status here.   AMBIANCE  They only had outdoor seating when I was here because of COVID. I sat on the covered outdoor seating which was great since it was around summertime. It was HOT! Really cute tables, friendly/helpful staff, and live music! I don't remember his name but there was a gentleman playing guitar and singing. He was fantastic!   DRINKS I ordered 3 drinks. The first two were the Comanchero and the third was The Copperhead. I'm glad I stopped there. They are strong!   I'm giving it four stars because I felt like the size of the drinks didn't coincide with their prices. I hope I get to stop by here again. It's a bit of a drive for me. It's a really beautiful drive though. Keep kicking butt y'all! I want to try everything!!

reviews.author: Jill C.
reviews.description: First time trying Sotol, and there wasn't a cocktail on the menu that wasn't incredibly delicious. We sat outside in the lovely fall weather, enjoyed some acoustic tunes by a talented duo with a female vocalist, and tried several cocktails -- all of which we enjoyed. My friend tried the frozen Bartender's Choice which was like a frozen apple cinnamon cocktail, and I tried the Comanchero, the Yipping Coyote, and the Rugged Flower. Each were so smooth and well-balanced. This place not only makes a flavorful Sotol with a smooth, clean finish but transforms it into mouth-watering mixology masterpieces!   Aside from the bus loads of out-of-town tourists who looked like they were part of an Instagram filter for an "Ashley/Ashleigh" compilation (complete with brimmed hat, scarf, and boots), this place is a must-visit if you're in Austin. Couple it with a trip to nearby Fredericksburg and you've got yourself an amazing day!

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Finally decided to take a day trip down to dripping springs and had to finally stop at Desert Door. To start, this place is designed so beautifully. I wish I could steal the dcor and put it into my own home. Both the inside and out were so inviting, I don't know how someone could go and not spend hours enjoying the ambiance, food, and drinks. What I thought was so cool about Desert Door was that they educated you on what you were drinking and the history of Sotol. What I did not know, is that they are actually the only Sotol distillery in the US.  We started off with the Sotol flight, and two drinks. Although we did enjoy tasting the Sotol by itself, it was a lot to start the afternoon off with! We also ordered the The Copperhead (my personal favorite of the day), the River Rita, and the Sotol'd Fashioned. I loved each drink but the copperhead was definitely the star of the day, which was a Sotol version of an espresso martini. They also have a food truck on site serving out very unique food. We ordered the tacos and vegan "queso" and both really surprised us by how unique and amazing it was. We loved this trip out to Desert Door, and will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Corey R.
reviews.description: Our server was Meryl, our waitress was amazing.  Loved the frozen drink on a warm afternoon.  Live music playing.  Life doesn't get better than this!!!

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: I'm generally not a huge fan of tasting rooms and find them gimmicky and far from truly experiencing the spirit of the spirit. See what I did there.   But every rule has its exception, or exceptional. Desert Door is a destination in itself. Beautiful southwestern interiors and stylish furniture. The space is cozy but didn't feel crowded, though every table was full. They do have a large patio for outdoor seating and bigger groups.   Now, the sotol. I had never heard of it and didn't know what to expect. The best way I can describe it is an agave spirit, clear, between a vodka and a tequila in its thickness/smoothness. In plain English, it's delicious.   We did the tasting flight, which was a great way to get introduced to a new spirit, followed by a round of cocktails. The cocktails were excellent and reasonably priced.   They also had a lovely food truck on site but we didn't have enough time to try it.

reviews.author: Deborah C.
reviews.description: So glad we stopped by Desert Door on our way to a Getaway cabin.  The mixed drinks are on point! The entire staff were so friendly. Cozy/desert vibe inside! Huge outdoor covered area with plenty of picnic benches and  lounge seating.  I can't remember who our server was but she was freakin awesome! She brought our pup a pupsicool (bone broth frozen pup treat) to keep cool and occupied lol. Pup also sported a DD bandanna : )  We didn't order any food from the food truck, but appreciated the option to order quick bites.

reviews.author: Jonathan S.
reviews.description: Great Vibe, great drinks and the service is superb!! Ask for Nicole :). She was wonderful and really explained the whole history of the sotol plant. Will come back for sure as this place is a gem!!!

reviews.author: Meaghan S.
reviews.description: Ended up at Desert Door after a lunch at Saltlick. Doot, the host, got us seated right away at a cozy soft seating area outside. Great patio vibes: chill, mist fans going , and live music about to start. Inside is nice too, super clean and cute/trendy.   The sotol is great and their cocktails are delicious, as well as unique. Had a difficult time deciding which one to get but our attentive and extremely friendly waitress, Nicole strayed me the right way with the Comanchero. Hubs got the ranch water (served in a Topo Chico, gotta love that)!   Nicole our waitress and Erin the bartender are solid assets at this establishment! Thank y'all for a great Saturday afternoon!

reviews.author: CARLA B.
reviews.description: OMG!  Where do I start.  Stumbled across this gem riding to the Salt Lick in Driftwood.    Staff was great with explaining Sotols and provided amazing  recommendations.    The Sotol Flight is great.  My fav was the Gin forward Sotol as I have gravitated towards Gin in the last few months   Love band outside play with amazing indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful, can't-miss distillery in Texas Hill Country!   We were absolutely shocked by how much we loved Sotol after trying it first as a standalone shot. And they sure know how to do a cocktail, too! I got the River Rita and it legit blew my mind.   Sit and stay awhile, listen to the live music on the patio and if you need to cool down, the interior is a WHOLE mood.   Be sure to visit their gift shop to buy an adorable handmade clay shotglass (SO CUTE) and a bottle of their famous Sotol.   The staff was also astoundingly friendly and the kind of people you want to hang out with.

reviews.author: Corianne O.
reviews.description: Honestly great environment. Good drinks AND live music. So much fun. Really loved the drinks and the tequila. Nicole gave us our drinks and she had the absolute best service. If you can request her, I would. 10/10 experience.

reviews.author: Ang B.
reviews.description: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. Love these folks and I know some day we'll go out there and there will be a wait, for now it's still somewhat of an unknown. We've only had wonderful cocktails and bought several bottles of Sotol from them. I like that it has less carbs than tequila! Anyway, the choice of food truck out there is solid (Eden).  I wish I could live next door!

reviews.author: Shelly M.
reviews.description: Had an amazing hour enjoying sotol cocktails! Erin and Nicole are amazing. So glad we decided to stop in and can't wait to come back with friends! Facility is gorgeous and has a beautiful West Texas vibe. Can't wait to enjoy music on the porch!

reviews.author: Erin D.
reviews.description: Just left here with our crew! Here for a wedding and this place was recommended to us. It did not disappoint. Kelsey was the BEST waitress. She was so nice, helpful, and friendly. We all talked about her and how great she made our experience. The drinks were awesome and the vibe of the place is great. Highly recommend you come here! Be sure to request Kelsey for the best service!

reviews.author: Anh N.
reviews.description: So glad we finally stopped in to DD! Great distillery with ample patio and outdoor seating! Loved all of their cocktails. They also have live music.  Try the food truck Eden West on site, their quail bites are delish!

reviews.author: Thiago M.
reviews.description: Third update. They certainly read the reviews and made drastic improvements. Gets 5 star from me now. Drinks and food are great!

reviews.author: Mckenna R.
reviews.description: OMG this place was something we happened to stumble upon and it is a Austin must! This is a great cocktail bar that is modern and very desert chic. We are so so happy we stopped here and will be buy thing their Stool back home to make our own delicious Palomas. Also whatever their berry cocktail is, is a must try.

reviews.author: Keith P.
reviews.description: We love this place. Taylor has been our waitress twice and has been amazing. She actually remembered us today...and we had only been here once before.  I had the flight again and it was amazing. We bought bottles to take home to keep on enjoying. We love coming here.

name: AquaBrew
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Addie W.
reviews.description: We had to plan a get together for our friends service last minute and we're running into dead ends with all the places we called. We spoke to Lauren, the owner at Aquabrew and they were incredibly kind and generous with allowing us to use their venue for after the service. When we got there, the GM, Hannah, took such great care of us and everyone else who attended. They went above and beyond for us during a difficult time and helped take one thing off our shoulders and for that they have earned our business forever. Really good people! Great beer!

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: We visited AquaBrew after eating at Industry next door. This brewery has many great beers on their list. I enjoyed the San Marcos Blonde.  There is plenty of indoor seating, a great patio and of course the bar area.  It was easy to social distance from other people and very clean. We will return. The staff was very nice and helpful. If you are looking for a good local brewery to support, AquaBrew is the place.

reviews.author: Shawna L.
reviews.description: Their new location wasn't updated on any maps so we ended up waking all around it until we called to find out what else we could use on maps to locate them. When we walked in we were very disappointed in their craft selection. I had researched this prior to choosing to go there based on their craft choices showed online. Again, something else that needed to be updated. Also, they aren't serving food. There was a large dog walking around that would come right up to you or sneak up under the tables and lick your feet. I like dogs so it was ok but for someone that doesn't..... Would not go back here until they get fully moved or opened.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: After going to the outlet mall we got a little thirsty we had already ordered some other food but we're unable to eat it within the restaurant so we called and asked awkward crew if we could order some of the beer and use your patio to eat our food they were very accommodating very nice people we even got to try to of their beers which tasted great

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: They've thought about everything at this brewery.  Great food, live music, seating inside, outside, and UPSTAIRS on the deck!  When the weather is right, they have the big glass garage doors open.  Yeah, they brew their own beer here and they have a decent selection.  It's not your typical brewery where you can just stroll in and choose the table you want to sit at.  That's because they have full table service for food and drinks.  I prefer breweries that let you wander around from the bar, to an outside table, to an inside table, and then back again - you know, rinse, lather, and repeat (relaxed and unstructured - I need that once in a while).  If you just want to stop in for a quick beer, you can sit at the bar.  The bar is quite large but also very popular with the college crowd, so it's hard to get a seat at times.   Now to the serious stuff - the beer!  I've had their Kolsch (San Marcos Blonde) and their Vienna Lager.  The blonde was the run of the mill Kolsch, not bad by any means, but the Vienna Lager - wow!  It had a great malty taste to it.  I liked it so much that I purchased a crowler of it to take home.  I rarely do that, so that tells you it must be good.  Enough useless banter - here's everything else you need to know about this place:  Free parking lot right next door or free 2 hr street parking.   Patio areas in the front and the back with overhead infrared heaters and fans with misters (they have both Texas seasons covered).  This place is popular with the college kids - TOO popular.  Growler refills are $12 or $18 for 64 oz, and $24 or $36 for 128 oz, depending on the beer you select.    Crowlers to go:  $8 or $10 (depending on the beer).  You can get three for $20 or $25 (depending on the beer).  Plenty of food options.   And I almost forgot to tell you - they have a FULL bar, not just beer!

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: Aquabrew is definitely a gem in San Marcos. I learned about it through the purchase of the brewery tour on Groupon. The tour was quaint because it's not that big, but very interesting.  The gentleman who gave the tour seemed a bit rushed at the end, but he answered our questions and seemed very knowledgeable.   At the end of the tour we got to sample some beer. They also have a beer club where you buy a growler, we got the one for $100, and join their beer club. You get a punch card for 10 refills on the growler. My husband and I got one each for $200. I was thinking it an "okay" deal i guess. Truthfully I wasn't that thrilled cause of the price. But OMG!!!! IT IS WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY FOLKS!!!!.   Aquabrew has some of the best beers around. I am Army and have lived and traveled all over the world and this lil place holds its ground when it comes to beers! Purchasing the growler is the best deal too.   I have not had the food yet, but the place is always busy and people seem to love it. And they have some of the cutest guys behind the bar.  In all, I give this gem an A+

reviews.author: Maggie M.
reviews.description: Used to be my favorite restaurant in San mo but returned recently and they have the weirdest vibe now. None of their food is offered (you get two options from a backyard stand) standoffish servers and a gloomy vibe. Sooooo disappointed and hope to see this place make it back to its prime.

reviews.author: Steve S.
reviews.description: The first thing about AquaBrew that I enjoyed was the vibe. This place really has a community feel with longer style tables and an incredible open patio with fans and lighting, ping pong and live music... and of course... beer.  The food was very flavorful. Thai chicken had good spice and the chicken thigh was tender and juicy. The Margarita flatbread was fresh tasting. The arugula salad was huge and bursting with fruits and flavor.  The beer was excellent and just what you'd expect from an onsite brewery.   Overall, if you're looking for a fun place for you and your peeps to chill, eat and drink in San Marcos... you'd do well to try this place. Plus it's right up the street from the Cheetham St warehouse.

reviews.author: Jesse M.
reviews.description: The beer was good but the food was not. Should have known better than to order the steak at a bar like restaurant but it was basically inedible. Not even my 11 year old daughter would eat it. Supposed to be medium and came through well done. The waitress asked and I told her it was cooked bad and we couldn't eat it and she said "yeah I saw that" and proceeded to do absolutely nothing to fix it or make it right.   I'll go there for the beer but never again for the food

reviews.author: Robert A.
reviews.description: The beer was good, but not many choices on the menu. The restaurant is clean and has a good vibe. The food.... well it looked good. The taste... somewhat bland. My son likes it but he lost his tastebuds in an accident as a child.   I would come back for the beer and appetizers, but would pass on the dinner.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: Service - 5/5 great customer service ! Our waiter was very attentive and met all our needs.  Atmosphere - 4/5 pretty nice place . Long tables instead of individual tables to encourage people to meet new people ! Which is a really awesome concept . Also there's a large bar since it's also a brewery.  Food- my food was about a 3.5/5 , but my friends was a solid 1. Her salmon Benedict had almost uncuttable biscuit since it was so hard , and the most burnt potatoes I've ever seen. My food which was the stuffed French toast was pretty yummy, but not a lot to it.  Noise level - 1/5 THE BAND WAS SOOO LOUD. I couldn't here my friend talking 1 foot in front of me :(  Price - 2/5 wayyyy overpriced for what you get. My French toast was 11.91 and my friends meal was 15.91  Probably won't return unless it's for a group outing , but still a cool little place to check out !

reviews.author: Kris N.
reviews.description: My fianc and I had an amazing experience at aquabrew. We got to talk a lot with the brewer CJ and he's extremely smart and knows what he's doing. We tried at least 6 of the different drafts and were impressed by them all. I definitely recommend this place if your wanting to experience a new brewery to checkout!

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Odd to see the plethora of reviews stating that the service here in subpar, as this was definitely not the case when I went yesterday. Easy to get a seat and our waitress was very attentive, despite it being happy hour and slightly busy on a Friday after work.  As a table, we ordered the: a) Brew House Pretzel - Amazingly soft and the beer queso is a great pairing  b) AB Bacon Jam Fries - HOLY! The bacon jam itself is something I've never had before and I must say this makes it a must return for me  c) Glass of Imperial Pilsner - Smooth and pretty standard for a Pilsner  d) Glass of Artificial Intelligence Tripel (9.72% ABV) - Yeah...the ABV tells the story itself  This spot has a great atmosphere, very rustic and cozy. Definitely a nice place, just wish you could order directly from the bar for faster access to beer.

reviews.author: Luz C.
reviews.description: This place is AMAZING!!! The food was well executed and so delicious that I just want to pack up and move to Austin so I can be a local!! If you want delicious food, great drinks, a casual yet elevated ambiance I'd say look no where else and go here. The waiter was fantastic (I can't believe I forgot his name). He was helpful and very knowledgeable of the menu. His suggestions were all a match to our taste buds.   Can't wait to go to Austin to eat here again!

reviews.author: Tom C.
reviews.description: You know when someone takes a picture of themselves and posts it on Instagram,and it's at just the right angle to make them look super attractive? The Yelp reviews of this place kind of remind me of that. It's not that it was bad, but I was expecting a lot more.  The highlight of my meal was the Mosaic IPA. Balanced and drinkable, this beer was really enjoyable. I also tried the Swine Dive IPA. The taste of this was a little too clean for an IPA and just didn't have the hoppy depth to add to its character. Not bad, but I wouldn't get it again.  Overall the food I ordered was really lackluster. I didn't hate it, but it certainly wasn't a memorable meal. My chicken empanadas were oily, and had very little chicken in the filling. The whole thing struck me as more of acorn dog egg roll hybrid, and didn't really seem like an empanada at all. I was grateful for the spicy sauce it was served with, which was pretty tasty. I also ordered the brussel sprouts. There were some decent flavors here, but I would have really preferred them to have a little more char on them. They came across as slightly undercooked and worse yet, very wet. A little crispness would have gone a long way.  Service was fair, friendly enough but really on the slow side. It took me almost a half an hour to get my food and it wasn't crowded. The couple at the bar sitting next to me ordered hamburgers. I have to admit I was a little jealous because they looked good. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing. Maybe it was a bad night. Whatever the reason I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.

reviews.author: Kevin E.
reviews.description: Great location and cool venue. It's evident a lot of time and thought were put into this place.   Great beers, especially liked the Ape-ricot Wheat.   I wish I saved room for the Porter Ice Cream Float.   The AB burger was solid, maybe a little messy tho.  Forget the fries tho. The regular fires were under seasoned and chewy. Think Wendy's fries when you  don't finish them at lunch and try to eat them at the end of your shift. Bleh  The staff was super friendly.   The outdoor portion looks great but a bit too hot out today to go and enjoy it.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: What an awkward night...Our server did not check on us. We had to continue to ask for things...multiple times, from multiple people. That portion of the night really sucked.  Howeverrrr, the street corn, queso, crispy tuna, edamame, and loaded fried were reallyyyy good. We especially loved the street corn. I wish we would've gotten the delicious food on time, instead of having to remind the staff multiple times butttt at least it tasted amazing??   I can't give them more stars even though the food was great because service is so so so important.

reviews.author: Jan C.
reviews.description: Unfortunately the new menu and chef drops the rating from 5 to 4. Still friendly waitstaff and excellent happy hour. But the reason I come to AquaBrew and recommend it to everyone I meet is the food. The "new" salmon dish isn't even close to the goodness of the previous balsamic salmon with veggies. Dry. Lacked flavor. Sticky rice instead of the delish potatoes and only green beans instead of a mix of seasonal veggies. Hubby had the tostadas and 'meh' reaction. Will give it one more try before relegating it to happy hour only place with 3 stars. So sad.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: Just left after lunch. Cute/hip spot with friendly staff.   We ordered the AB burger and I did an upgrade to their bacon jam fries ($4 upgrade). I was so excited to try these fries but they were very underwhelming to me. $4 is steep for an up charge but had I enjoyed them I wouldn't have minded. The burger was the best bite on the table. It was small in size but very juicy and tasty. Not one to split.   Next up was the fried chicken and eggs. It has so many things I typically like - fried chicken, cream gravy, bacon jam, eggs, but I didn't like this dish. It lacked dimension of flavor. It needed something. The herbed fries that came with it were good. I liked them better than the $4 bacon jam ones.   Our kids split the stuffed French toast. The only ate a little bit because it was too sweet. If a kid thinks something is too sweet you know it's toooooo sweet. Neither ate it. It was a waste of money.   Overall I'm glad we tried it but don't need to return on our own accord.

reviews.author: Emari S.
reviews.description: Omg I tried their Shrimp and Grits and they were delicious  and I Also tried their bacon jam fries and they were impeccable. I really enjoyed the margarita I had and the atmosphere was nice. Are usually never think of AquaBrew to eat at, but now that I finally tried it, I will definitely go back! Love it! The shrimp and grits is super buttery but I LOVE IT

reviews.author: Warren P.
reviews.description: I give this place a 5 star just on the restaurant ambience alone. Industry is open, fun and relaxing. The food is outstanding. We had the pork tacos and quesadillas which were excellent. The sweet tea is also a nice drink if your into teas. They have a patio area which is comfortable and allows for a cool indoor - outdoor experience.   I'm new to San Marcos but this is going to be my first " go-to" when I need a great taco. Hands down a highly recommend!

reviews.author: Larry C.
reviews.description: Good food, TERRIBLE SERVICE! My daughter finished her lunch before mine showed up. I had to ask the waitress where mine was, she checked and said it was next up. 10 minutes later still no lunch. I checked and it was behind 4 other orders! Their excuse was that mine had to be cooked, but it doesn't take 30 minutes to tear up a couple tortillas, heat them in salsa and fry a couple eggs to put on top!  They won't have another opportunity to provide me with bad service and excuses!

reviews.author: Deya Z.
reviews.description: Food was amazing but service was eh. I've been to my fair share of food halls and similarly set up places, but this one was a little confusing walking in. Think hop daddy or a similar restaurant. Once you order at the front, grab your seat and make yourself comfortable. I stopped by on a Saturday early afternoon, and luckily enough it wasn't super busy. If you if anyone was wearing a mask. But since this is Texas I guess COVID doesn't exist.  Onto the food! I ordered off of their brunch menu which was super delicious. The Chilla Quiles were enormous l!!    I sat down at the bar, which was OK and really where my four-star review comes from. The bartender was nice enough, but really didn't seem interested in actually serving people. She's definitely one of those bartenders that wants to give you your drink and then get you out of her face. It wasn't super clear to me how to check out so I asked another random person that came by and they were kind enough to explain the process to me. Being from out of town, folks in Texas sure aren't as nice as we say we are. And I say this as someone born and raised in Texas.

reviews.author: Jes T.
reviews.description: Randomly ended up here.  Great environment.  I ordered the pork pancakes and it was definitely something different.  I also accidentally ordered a breakfast shot, which I thought was just a drink.   It ended up being good and unique but got me buzzed so I had to chill a bit since I'm not a big drinker.  I was mostly passing through on a lazy Sunday but would enjoy coming back.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: We happened to be in the area and stumbled across Industry as a brunch option. First, today is pretty cold outside and their wall windows (?) are wide open. I get it, it's their design. We were considering finding another spot, but decided to stay and try it out. I ordered the chilaquiles w/ chicken, hubs got the chicken sando, and we had a side of the green chile queso. The food came out at a decent pace. The queso was barley luke warm. Why? It tasted okay, flavors are nothing special, but I was expecting it to be warmer than what it was. When our order came out, my chilaquiles were also luke warm, if not almost cold. Is the cold air chilling the food quicker than normal? Probably not. The side of beans and rice I had was piping hot and I ate that towards the end of my meal. The chilaquiles were made w/ the chips that they serve with their chips and dip; not a fan of that. The hub's sando was good. Overall, 3 stars cuz the flavors weren't that bad: I was willing to overlook the cold dining room, but not the almost cold food.

reviews.author: Heather R.
reviews.description: TLDR a-ok to I'm a fan despite some bumps  My first time ordering for pickup. Everything was delicious, it was ready at the time promised. The big flaw was I didn't get the beer battered squash I ordered and paid for, but as Mr R didn't check the bag before leaving we cannot lay that all on them. It was a very busy night and mistakes happen.  The other error was I didn't get the 30% off to-go booze still advertised on their online menu which is why this isn't 5*  Mr R is besotted with their black bean veggie burger. I think there must be spice in the patty as none of the other listed ingredients explain its lovely low heat. He also likes the texture of the bean patty, he wanted me to mention that.  The salmon burger was good, huge, nice fresh veg, I love the spice in the aioli and poblano ranch, but I REALLY wish they still did the smoked salmon bagel I had one brunch there long ago.  The farm beet salad? Gorgeous. Mr R gleefully ate most of it on his own and he often eats salads with a sense of duty rather than joy. I loved the white balsamic vinaigrette it came with, I'm going to need that more often in my life.  The drinks to go? Hooray! One note, bring your own standard brown pulp drink tray if you think you'll need one because they didn't provide one. The pours were fabulous on our mimosas, The Closer and White Box. Ice was the perfect amount.  The transaction could have gone smoother, but the meal went down great. This remains a place Mr R wants to go *every* time he's in town.

reviews.author: Josseline R.
reviews.description: We ordered from UberEats and after having them call to say they were out of the Salmon Burger and Catfish with Chips we opted out for the Chicken Friend Chicken and Fried Chicken Burger. The order was delayed by 35 minutes which is understandable since they had to switch out our meals. But once we got our meals we realized the sides that come with the entres were missing completely as well.  Starving my friend dug into his Chicken Fried Chicken and I took a few bites of the sandwich. He was basically done with it when he cut into the last bits and realized that the food was indeed cold and fleshy. I stopped to look at mine and I was baffled by the underlying pink on the bottom of the chicken patty. He immediately regurgitate it back up and I stopped and threw the rest of my sandwich away.    We spent over 70 dollars on a meal that had to be thrown away. The only things we did eat were our Brussels sprouts and cheese fries.   Will not be eating here again.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Great burger and fries. Mixed drinks very good. Service also very good. Definitely will return!

reviews.author: Valle K.
reviews.description: This was my first time to have brunch at Industry. I gave them an over all three stars only because they lost one star on my dish, I ordered biscuits and gravy super dry not enough gravy for the portion of the biscuit. Then they lost the second star because half way through my meal, my mimosa never arrived! I was parched and when I asked the waitress she said " I lost your ticket, I will put in your  order" I don't understand how that even works when you order at the front of the restaurant.  The food could be warmer came out cold. The presentation of the food was great, customer service was great, the ordering process smooth.

reviews.author: Dawn M.
reviews.description: Hip spot for beer, cocktails and satisfying pub grub with a twist. The burgers and fries are tops, and the salmon burger is very tasty. The loaded nachos are over the top and amazing, can feed an army. Great corner hang with friendly bartenders and staff.

reviews.author: Brii R.
reviews.description: I was on a road trip and decided to stop here and try it out. I stopped during brunch time. The menu options were limited. The food was decent but I enjoyed the atmosphere the most - very chill and open.

reviews.author: Skih N.
reviews.description: First time here was pretty okay. I ordered the brisket tacos which were $13 with a side of chips, i thought the proportions were way too small given the price. I also expected the tacos to be a bit bigger but were still good tasting. The mac and cheese tho, was p bomb ngl. Overall, the restaurant and staff were nice, I might come here again.

reviews.author: Holmes O.
reviews.description: Madison ... Madison... Madison! She was absolutely wonderful today. Welcoming.. knowledgeable and provided an amazing customer experience today. Can't wait to see you guys soon!   - Holmes

reviews.author: Halee G.
reviews.description: MANNNN, this place is such a vibe and even better...the food is amazing. I ordered a little from every food genre and each of them hit the spot. 10/10 will definitely come again!

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: The Moscow mule was amazing!! So I'm new to exploring San Marcos and I looked up most reviewed or topped reviewed. I am not disappointed. This place is great!

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: This place sucks! It's not satisfying nor flavorful. The chili is like soup no meat or anything in it! Yea it may look good but it's not.

reviews.author: Taylor B.
reviews.description: We came down from Dallas and made industry our 1st-night-in-town place for drinks and dinner. We had an awesome time with Thor as our bartender last time we were in town. He was there this time and we got to say hi again. We sat at the bar and Raina took great care of us! We tried 2 lagers from different TX breweries and had some great shots. I could not decide among 3 choices for dinner, so I let her pick and surprise me. She chose the al pastor tacos. They were delicious! We are only staying in San Marcos 4 days and are already planning to go back for dinner on Monday! Ps if you are a whiskey drinker, try this! It was so smooth!

reviews.author: Gem T.
reviews.description: This must be a very popular place. Came in for Sunday brunch and it was packed! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The $11  mimosa carafe special immediately got my attention. I knew I had to have that. Found us a booth on the left corner by the bar. Ordered the mimosa, 2 industry burgers, Parmesan fries and the tater tot casserole. The mimosa was disappointingly room temperature. The burgers were bordering on salty but were good. We especially liked the chips and salsa that came with it. The fries were good but a little expensive for what you get. The tater tot casserole , we didn't like at all. Very salty and the hot sauce did not go with the dish at all. Don't think we'll come back.

reviews.author: Leslie C.
reviews.description: There were mixed reviews...the adults loved their food! We had the CFC w queso - gave it two thumbs up!! We also had the chicken tacos and the person who had those raves about how good they were! We also had the queso, salsa, fried squash, loaded fries and Brussel sprouts for appetizer and all were a huge hit!! Most of the teenagers had the burgers and did not like them. They said they tasted like sausage. I think the issue is the burgers were very, very lean and smoked so they were a little dry.  The BIGGEST COMPLAINT were the flies...OMG!!! So freaking annoying to have to constantly be waving your hand back and forth so a darn fly does not land on your food!! Do something about that bc we would never come back solely for that purpose!

reviews.author: John L.
reviews.description: Loved the smoked brisket! Andi was so helpful and the atmosphere was chill. My daughter will attend TXSU in fall, I'll definitely be back to try other dishes like the pancakes... Great locally owned restaurant/bar. My wife is happy :)

reviews.author: L S.
reviews.description: Awesome place!!!! Great selection of spirits!! The people there are very friendly and knowledgable. We also like giving our support to this locally (non franchised) business

reviews.author: Ju L.
reviews.description: Long overdue review, but I appreciated the gentleman who wrapped my last minute Christmas gift. I just asked for a paper bag but he went the extra miles to make it all nice with wrapping paper and bow. Thanks :) will be back

reviews.author: William D.
reviews.description: Nope, will not return here.  Barely a mumble from store employee after entering their store that was empty of patrons.  I remember coming here at their Grand Opening and they were a lot more enthusiastic about their customers. Hopefully, they will find better help soon.

reviews.author: Mike K.
reviews.description: Will not be returning here. Selection is ok not great, service is ok, however , these days most do not carry cash and to be up charged for using a debit card to pay for the CC service is a joke, and pay attention to the amount  almost 4% of the total, I am thinking another way to profit a little at a time. Just bad business not whiskey business

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: I waked into this store not expecting much.  Boy, was I wrong.  He has a really good selection of bourbon.  I walked out with a bottle that I've never seen on any other shelf, anywhere else.  It wasn't much more expensive than the larger stores, and he actually had it.  I didn't even check out the scotch selection, which I  need to go back and do.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Karen P.
reviews.description: They have a good selection but they are kinda pricey. Perfect if you just need a bottle but not if you're looking to restock several items.

reviews.author: Sarah E.
reviews.description: Came in to make it quick liquor store run, left with two welcoming friends and a much greater appreciation of all the options at my fingertips. Waylon and Weston where more than available to answer questions and make recommendations and overall create a hospitable and enjoyable shopping experience. I look forward to going back and taking some friends with me because I know we won't be disappointed in the party they help supply!

reviews.author: Geary H.
reviews.description: One of the first things when I entered their store, their dog "Whiskey" greeted me, then the owners. Handshakes when you show up; that's Texas! Whiskey Business has a diverse, quality, well-priced inventory. They had everything I needed. Even took home a six of Boerne Brewery's Old Courthouse Ale at the owner's suggestion. It's like he knew what I'd like. He did. One of my favorites is an Irish dry stout {think Guinness}, and I've now found a new favorite. Love it! I'll make Whiskey Business my go-to. Thank you for your hospitality!

reviews.author: Kodi S.
reviews.description: A new liquor store in town! Great selection, I put in a few requests and they had them in by the next visit. The staff is awesome, very friendly folks. I wont lie, I'm a regular now mostly because of their dog- Whiskey.

reviews.author: Nechelle D.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable and courteous service. Definitely where I'll always go and send everyone!

reviews.author: Aneesa K.
reviews.description: Gorgeous property, fabulous restaurant.  Huge outdoor property to sit and enjoy the view.  Dogs welcome!  Big plus.

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: This winery is so beautiful, I could live there.   The views are breathtaking, and the main house is absolutely impressive, I was so impressed with the property I had to explore it further on my own.   They have been operating since 2004 and turned the former residence into a tasting, event and sales space. The sunroom and patio are perfect for enjoying a tasing or a bottle of wine among friends.   I actually sampled all of the wines on my visit to the vineyard, of course my preference is red, but I found many of the whites quite refreshing. Although the pool is no longer used for swimming, it makes an excellent backdrop, stop in and set a spell! Cheers!

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Beautiful location next to an Italian restaurant (they aren't affiliated). We got food from them and ate at a picnic table outside the winery. We tried two whites and a red, fairly inexpensive for a glass of wine. I think I paid $6-$8 per glass.. and they were all delicious! The only struggle is to find a place to sit during a weekend.. took a bit of patience before we got a spot. Dog friendly outside, too :)

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: I'm a huge fan of the property and how much green space they offer and the nibbles offered are quite tasty (especially the truffle fries). I'm not weeping with joy from any of the wines but they're easy enough to drink.  It's particularly lovely for violet crown sunsets, so save it for your last stop if you're making the rounds in this neck of the woods.  They don't have any ice, which I find supremely odd being that it's Texas and they serve white wine! If you want to keep your wine chilled while sitting outside (they've got plenty of gorgeous trees to provide shade but shade is not a wine bucket!) the only way to do so is to drink it real fast while thinking cold thoughts.

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: This is a must-stop on your wine tour and where we began ours! The architecture alone is a photographer's paradise and the wine is wonderful.   We were a little disappointed to hear that, as of our visit in May, they weren't doing tastings due to Covid because I do think it can be done safely and would've made for a better experience. Otherwise, you either have to buy a full bottle or multiple bottles if you'd like a well-rounded understanding of their wines. We opted for a blend that we absolutely loved, described on the bottle as a "patchwork quilt of grapes." It was honestly worth every penny--so delicious!   We took our bottle and glasses outside onto the expansive lawn which is just perfect for picnics. They have lots of shaded tables under the old growth trees.   Perhaps for safer tastings they could serve them "beer flight" style with the informational flyer and direct you to sit outdoors so that you can still experience a handful of their wines without breaking the bank? That would make it a 5-star experience for me!

reviews.author: Elizabeth D.
reviews.description: Lovely area and great tasting menu. They have lovely picnic tables outside to bring your own snacks or enjoy their pizza or charcuterie boards alongside bought bottles. I just wish they had some music playing it was very quiet like pin drop quiet. I feel as though that might add a more comforting ambience. However we enjoy it very much and the restaurant near by looked spectacular

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: Duchman is one of my favorites around the area. The winery is simple and small but has an European charm.   I've done the tasting before and also just purchased wine by glass. Both are delightful. Tasting is nice for first timers to explore a variety of wines Duchman produces. Because of the tasting, I was able to find my favorite red and white wine of theirs. And for $10/tasting, it is such a steal!! (Price may have changed. This was based off of 2018). After my first visit, I just opt to get a bottle or glass of my favorite red and sip it on the patio taking in good wine, views, and company.   My friends and I always love to end our Hill Country winery trek at Duchman and drive over to Salt Lick after for good ol Texas BBQ.

reviews.author: Natalie G.
reviews.description: Decided to discover wineries on a Tuesday without realizing that most of the wineries in the area are closed. Landed at Duchman's on accident but feel like we found the best one! Kate was friendly and very knowledgeable. She made our experience amazing and we look forward to returning. Took home a bottle of Progression 2!

reviews.author: Lisa L.
reviews.description: The winery is beautiful and the wine is ok but we didn't find the staff to be very friendly. We ordered two snacks and both left a lot to be desired. The watermelon was soggy and smooshed up. We tossed whether to bring it back or not, and finally I did. The girl brought me another one which was fresh. Why serve me the nasty one first?? Unfortunately our experience wasn't good.

reviews.author: Peyton M.
reviews.description: My friends and I had the pleasure of doing a wine tasting with Andrea. The wines tended to be lighter which was perfect for a hot Texan day in July! Later, we had a ton of fun chatting with Javier and some other staff while enjoying a bottle of their finest. Very fun time here and the entire property is beautiful!   The wine tasting was $17 per person.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This was actually one of my favorite stops in our Driftwood wine tasting day. This particular winery has outdoor picnics for groups and benches for smaller groups for one to buy a bottle , bring some of your own food and enjoy their wines. During this pandemic time, this is the perfect scenario to drink wine while still practicing social distancing.   They do allow you to use the restroom with mask wearing enforced for you to go inside the building.   Their wine was light and refreshing. We chose  a white wine.   If you go near the end of the day you enjoy a nice sunset followed by lighted trees giving you a Christmas vibe. Up until that day , I never knew that Texas had a winery side like Driftwood but places like Duchman Family Winery proved to me that they do exist and they have really good wine too. Highly recommend you make a stop at this winery.

reviews.author: Ann R.
reviews.description: What a LOVELY VENUE! Absolutely adored our wine!  The staff was knowledgeable.  They aren't doing tastings due to Covid but u can buy a bottle and drink on premises.  We probably would have bought more if we could taste, we usually do.

reviews.author: Ren D.
reviews.description: Before our visit we were so excited to visit this place. It was a nice place out but if we felt ignored. They really have poor customer service. I had a review but it was taken down by yelp for whatever reason, I was so surprise when from rude employee message me on my yelp apologizing personally, and apparently there was a guy anonymously message me regarding my review to be reposted. Eventually found they are working together and engaging me on whatever conflict they have. Thus, proven that they really have poor customer service , very unprofessional.I wont be surprise if they will ask yelp to take my review down again.

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Not doing wine tasting due to COVID while others in the region have all started doing it. Even glass options would be good...but you can only buy bottles. Tried the rose and it was good. Made from locally sourced Sangiovese, which was a nice plus.

reviews.author: Afshin D.
reviews.description: I live in California and only an hour away from Napa. I wasn't expecting anything close to what one would experience in Napa. However, I still wasn't fully pleased.   The only way I can imagine that someone would really enjoy it, is to bring your own picnic and use their outdoor seating area. This is of course conditioned on the weather and also whether or not there is gonna be any bachelorette party there during your visit. (We saw two when we visited and they were so loud and they had overtaken all the outdoor seatings)  We tried their tasting. It was only $15 which is relatively cheap. In Napa you pay 2-3x more than that in a good winery. They let you choose your own 5 wines out of their selection or go with their recommendation. The tasting overall was okay, nothing that I disliked and at the same time nothing wowed me. I'm not sure if I'm gonna go back there, but it was worth to try it once.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Nice stop just outside Austin for a wine tasting! The outside setting is very cool, spacious front lawn and some tables/chairs for hanging out. Dropped into this place for a quick wine tasting, consisting of 6 small pours of wine. The whites we tasted were all very smooth, not overly sweet but just the right amount of smooth and dry. Definitely recommend sampling all the whites if you have time, you won't be disappointed!  We didn't go check out Trattoria next door for food, but have been there in the past and pretty good Italian food, pairs well with the winery.  If you come here and the weather is looking good, you can expect a very scenic, picturesque spot to spend some time at!

reviews.author: Natalie L.
reviews.description: Awful. Went here for my 21st birthday celebration with a small group of friends. We were completely respectful and there for a wine tasting and there were rude remarks made about our age and backhanded comments along with nobody taking us seriously or serving us promptly.

reviews.author: Carol B.
reviews.description: Over priced tasting . $17 tasting for very small pours of 6 wines . No water in tasting room. Had to go get it yourself . No crackers or palate cleansers . If it was a free tasting I wouldn't care as much . When I made reservation I was specific about food and was not given accurate info. You are not able to order food or eat during the tasting. Food only available to purchase after tasting was over. Servers poured wine on top of previous tasting . Missed poured twice . Server changed frequently and not consistent. They obviously are not organized to keep track of what wine we should be on . Huge red wine fan( live in Europe for 6 years ) was not a fan of  any of the reds . Surprisingly liked 2 of the whites, Beautiful atmosphere and building . A shame the tasting experience doesn't match . Could be so much better!!

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: Duchman is a great winery to visit near Austin that makes great wines.  I've recently been on a kick to learn more about and try Texas wines.  I've tried wine from several different Texas wineries in the past couple months (all purchased from wine stores) and Duchman is so far my favorite.  I prefer red wines and my favorite Duchman wines are the Aglianico and Sangiovese. Since the winery is so close to Austin, my husband and I decided to visit.  The grounds are beautiful - the perfect place for a picnic.  I appreciate the precautions they've taken due to COVID-19 too.  You can't go into the building (though they will let you in if you need to use the restroom), so they are set up outside selling wine by the bottle and require everyone to wear a mask.  There is plenty of space to picnic and social distance.  They sell some picnic meals on-site, but we brought pizza from Pieous, bought a bottle of wine, and had a lovely time relaxing at a picnic table in the shade.  I highly recommend visiting Duchman.  I'm happy there is a winery that makes great wines so close to Austin.  Even if you can't do a tasting during COVID-19, it is still worth the drive to drink wine in a pretty setting!

reviews.author: Alice R.
reviews.description: Really beautiful property. We wanted to go to Salt Lick and wanted to find some other activities in the area so came here for a tasting before lunch. They do $15 for 6, which is pretty good, and was offering 5% off your total bill for following them on Instagram.   There's some beautiful benches set up outside to go with your glass of wine. It unfortunately seemed to be drought season when we visited so the actual grape plants were pretty bare. Once you step inside, there's a small room where the tastings happen and the shop where they sell bottles and all kinds of souvenirs. There unfortunately wasn't any seating indoors so we had to stand the entire time. If you walk in more, you can see barrels and label making rooms. Wish they had given us more history during our tasting but it was fun nonetheless.   It was pretty easy to get an uber out here from the city but be warned getting an uber out here may take a little while.

reviews.author: D H.
reviews.description: We loved our wine tour with Taste of the Hills. We visited three wineries with two other couples on the tour. Each stop was unique and Jodie was especially knowledgeable and friendly. She is completely worth trying the tour!   Bonus: we got engaged after the tour!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Jodie was the best!  I found Taste of the Hills on yelp.  I messaged Jodie in April to see what her pricing and availability was for Memorial Day weekend and she responded quickly. Paid deposit through venmo and paid the other half day of our tasting. We did one winery, one distillery and one brewery. She gave us a small history of each of the places we went too. Her cheese board setup was amazing! Very sweet and easy going. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Chandler W.
reviews.description: Jodie made my day all I could have dreamed of. Her bus is super nice, well air conditioned and plenty of space, her knowledge of each winery was very cool to hear and she made sure we were always comfortable! On a warm summer day we were kept cool, fed, and full of wine! Must book with Jodie for a trip around the hill country. Delicious wine and charcuterie board! Thank you Jodie!

reviews.author: Cheryl J.
reviews.description: OMG, Jodie is FaNtAsTiC! My bff and I were on our annual girl's trip and wanted to book a wine tour before we left the Hill Country of Texas. We were staying in the adorable town of Wimberley so I researched tours in the area.  Jodie's Taste of the Hills Tour got great reviews and went to wineries close to the Wimberley area. The day of the tour ended up being chilly and rainy. As soon as Jodie pulled up with her spectacular shuttle-like van she was out like a flash with pretty umbrellas for us! We went to 3 different wineries which we thoroughly enjoyed! After the first one, we returned to Jodie's vehicle and she had a gorgeous tray for us of cheese,  sausage,  crackers,  grapes,  olives, dips.....simply divine!!! The tour was also just the 2 of us and we loved that Jodie still did ALL of this for a tour that I believe takes up to 12 people! The next time we plan a trip to the Hill Country we are going to do one of Jodie's Beer tours!! We had such great conversations with Jodie too! Thank you sooooo much for the GREAT time! Sooooo much fun!

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: Amazing tour!!! My wife and I came into Wimberley during Spring Break to relax from teaching and this was the perfect trip to do so! Jodie made us all feel like we were old friends, even though we had never met anyone else on the bus.  She was very detailed with the stories of each winery, and explained all the different varietals, answering our every question along the way. The bus was very comfortable and clean, and she stored each bottle we purchased until the trip was over, but we could have had the bottles on the bus had we chosen to.  The wineries all seemed to know her, so they were expecting us and were incredibly friendly. We were not rushed anywhere, and still managed to make it back into town to enjoy shopping on the square.  My wife and I were pretty hungry by the time we had lunch, since we didn't have breakfast, but the tapas style lunch was perfect for the glass of wine we purchased to have with it. The lunch was delicious and filling.  Overall this was an amazing experience and I will be recommending this tour to everyone I know.

reviews.author: Samantha K.
reviews.description: The owner, Jodie, went above and beyond to make sure my birthday with 12 of my friends and family was a moment to remember and it was just that. She recommended the best of Driftwood and ended up going to Driftwood Estate Winery and Vista Brewery. We spent around 5 hours commuting, tasting, and even an impromptu cellar tour. Thanks again, Jodie! I highly recommend Taste of the Hills to everyone.

reviews.author: Jeffrey R.
reviews.description: Jodie is an exceptional chauffeur.  We had a blast for a friend's birthday! She knew all the great stops and her ride is smooth, comfy, and had a great sound system. We had so much fun!

reviews.author: Sona E.
reviews.description: This wine tour with Jodie is a must.  We got Serenity Inn on a Wednesday so we were lucky to be on the wine tour with only one other couple.  Jodie is such a pleasant and inviting soul. She asked about each person's preferences as to be able to personalize the tour and pick which wineries she decided to take us too.  She is very knowledgeable of the town and the wineries.  The lunch she provides is just amazing. By the time we were done I felt like I had made an incredible new friend. I can't wait to go back and do more tours.

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: This was such an incredible experience. Jodie picked us up at the Serenity Farm House Inn. She was so friendly and knowledgeable and super sweet. She knew all the best places to go. The picnic lunch she provided was amazing. I wouldn't change a thing about today. I would love to bring some friends and do it all over again.

reviews.author: Brooke K.
reviews.description: Myself,  my Aunt and my cousin took Jodie's winery tour yesterday and had an absolute blast! Jodie really personalized the tour based on our taste in wines. She has an extensive knowledge of wines, the wineries, the towns, etc. Our favorite part was lunch because of the views and the wonderful spread that was provided for us. I highly recommend this tour and in fact will probably we doing it again, soon, I hope.

reviews.author: Amber D.
reviews.description: Perfect - the highlight of our trip!  Jodie was the best, most fun, knowledgeable and coordinator.  We went to Driftwood, Duchman and Fall Creek Vineyards.  We were fortunate enough to have great people touring with us, and it made the tour all the more fun.  She prepared the best picnic lunch I've ever had.  Sugar Shack cake balls, meats, cheeses, crackers, hummus, a goat cheese something served on crackers (that I LOVED, and I hate goat cheese), spinach feta rolls, and I'm sure I'm forgetting something.  She was fully prepared for everything.  Boxes for the wine we bought, umbrellas in case in rained (it didn't), plenty of water...this wine tour couldn't have been more perfect if she tried.  Thanks, Jodie!

reviews.author: Charles J.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing!  Very knowledgeable and informative.  Has some great stories and makes it very fun.  And the wineries she took us to were fantastic!  I've been to some bad wineries and the Wimberley area has a lot of options and can be daunting to do yourself.  Plus, nice to have a driver.  . Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anita Y.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing! She asked what our preferences in wine were and brought us to wineries that best fit our palate. She had a delicious charcuterie board waiting for us. Super friendly and very knowledgeable on various places in Wimberley. I highly recommend Jodie!!!

reviews.author: Gwen L.
reviews.description: This was a Fantastic tour. The winery's were lovely and Jodie was the perfect host. Would do it again and recommend to anyone visiting Wimberly.

reviews.author: Amer S.
reviews.description: Jodie was an amazing host and she really made the evening perfect for my wife's 40th birthday! She took us to amazing tasting locations, she knew everyone and we received first class service. She even helped with dinner reservations! It really was an amazing evening largely due to Jodie and the exceptional service she provides! If you are looking for a fantastic wine tour, get in touch with Jodie and she will ensure that happens.

reviews.author: Vicky W.
reviews.description: Ahhhh! So very relaxing! Jodie Meyer knew all the tourists' names and made sure we got to know each other. She provided an excellent variety of foods including a hot portion and gluten-free (just in time `cause I was lit after the 1st vineyard). The three vineyards for that day were selected based on the wine preferences of the tourists that day (A+ perk). We never felt pushed or obligated to buy wines, but we all did because they were very good (!), and Jodie kept our purchases organized and stored for us. She also gave a good background on each vineyard and on the Wimberley area in general. We learned a lot about Wimberley and wine and were able to get tipsy knowing Jodie was an excellent driver of her comfy bus. And have you been to Wimberley? That hilly countryside is beautiful!

reviews.author: Linz N.
reviews.description: We recently went on a fabulous wine tour with Jodie on 4/15 and had a great time!  Our tour was originally scheduled for 10:30a, but got pushed back to 1:15p due to shuttle trouble (we had the option to receive our money back, but actually liked the later time).  We stopped at three wineries, including Driftwood Estate and Duchman Family Winery.  The views at all of the wineries varied, but each were unique to their locations.  Jodie provided an amazing picnic-style lunch, including a charcuterie (meat and cheese) board, chicken salad, nuts, walnut and feta salad, grapes, chocolate cake balls, bottled water, etc. At the second stop, Jodie was kind enough to call in people's orders to Salt Lick BBQ and had it all ready to take home by the third stop.  We can't wait to return again!

reviews.author: Debbie V.
reviews.description: Fantastic wine tour with a knowledgable , fun and personable guide. Jodi made our first wine tour experience a memorable one. Nice travel accommodations   We went to 3 local wineries chosen by our wine preferences. She provided a great tapas lunch and even accommodated the gluten free guests.  I would highly recommend   I will be coming back and doing it again!

reviews.author: Haeley B.
reviews.description: Jodie was awesome! We booked her for a bachelorette weekend wine tour and had an amazing day! Each winery was set up for tastings when we arrived. The tapas lunch was delicious and came with a gorgeous hill country view. Jodie went out of her way picking dinner up for us and storing all our purchases throughout the tour. She catered the tour to the pallet of the girls. I would definitely use her again!!

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: My mother and I had the most amazing time with Jodi. She was a perfect tour guide and took us to three great wineries. She gave us a lot of background information on the wineries as well as the town of Wimberley. She had a delicious assortment of snacks for us to munch on while we rode to and from each winery. She helped package our wine purchases and brought us umbrellas as it started to rain. She even went the extra mile, literally, and drove us back to our hotel since it was raining as we had walked to our meeting spot earlier in the day. We had another couple on the tour with us which was really nice since we had people to mingle with. It was a very personal experience and I felt as though we were all just great friends spending an afternoon together. Who needs Napa, everything is better in Texas!!! We will definitely be repeat customers.

reviews.author: Josh F.
reviews.description: Deepa made planning a rehearsal dinner from almost 5 hours away a breeze; helping me find a caterer and having the whole event go off without a hitch. Karen and Neil were extremely attentive and made everyone feel right at home. The wide variety of Texas craft beers, wines, and meads absolutely blew everyone in attendance away and we can't wait to go back to try the beverages we missed.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: Who knew there was such a thing as mead but the wonderful girl behind the counter helped us with choices and filled us with lots of knowledge.  My parents were staying at the cabins at onion creek right behind this place and when we stopped I saw a dog inside so I called my parents and said meet us up here and told my husband whoa we gotta pet that dog!  I enjoyed the bead as I had never had it before and loved the inside decor and how the place is set up.  Cozy if you want it, outside on the patio ( not for us since it was raining) up at the bar or in large tables.  If you're in the area its definitely a must.

reviews.author: Liana W.
reviews.description: I definitely recommend this tasting room!! It's right around the corner from Salt Lick and Duchman winery and definitely worth a stop!   We got a cider/mead/wine/beer flight (4 tastings, one of each).  Very cool interior design. A hidden gem- I hope you all try this place!

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: This place was ok. Didn't love it. Didn't hate it. My husband and I stopped in on a random day date through hill country on the way from Desert Door (excellent).

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Been here twice  and both times have been impressed with the variety and quality of their choices for wines and beers. Staff have been knowledgeable and friendly. Prices reasonable.  Met the owner tonight - really earnest, smart and nice guy. Only downer- Geeks who drink trivia. Absolutely despise it. Awkward format, unintelligible announcer, questions relevant only to the very young.  Won't be back for that.

reviews.author: David G.
reviews.description: Big ups to our new friend Jamie and his new place Hill country.  Very quaint place with two stories and plenty of samples for the beer drinker or wine drinker.  Your husband doesn't like wine?  No problem.   They got beer.  And plenty of it.   IPA's and Hefeweizen's will greet you at the door.   Family and pet friendly place. We will be back for sure.  Thank you for the awesome graciousness.

reviews.author: Kami C.
reviews.description: This is a great little place for wine or beer. They have a nice selection of great Texas wine and beer and the owner is a really nice guy.

reviews.author: Tracey N.
reviews.description: We are from the area and stumbled upon this gem.  The owner/bartender was outstanding and the place is out of a Pinterest page.  We bought a few bottles and hung out for a few hours.  We will be back and recommend this spot to anyone in the area.

reviews.author: Trent W.
reviews.description: Big fan of this place. Brand new building and very well cleaned and kept. We were greeted with great hospitality by our bartender. I had never tried mead before and was offered a tasting of it. We ended up having beer flights from their great selection. Perfectly located, close by to Salt Lick BBQ. Come to this place and try for yourself!

reviews.author: Cathy R.
reviews.description: We had my husband's 50th birthday party at Hill Country Tasting Room. Deepa was so helpful with coordinating all of the details. We met beforehand to plan where to place the food, decorations, and talk about special drink offerings. The staff was super friendly, went out of their way to make us feel welcome, and made it a very special night. We had a party of about 25 and the space was perfect! Would highly recommend and will definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: An oasis on RM150. Sort of in the middle of nowhere (for now), this place is a welcome sight for the people in Hill Country who like to drink. Beer, wine and mead only in a warm industrial space. The service was very accommodating, however not as knowledgeable as I had hoped, given the selection and the many questions several of us had as we tried mead for the first time. Prices seem to be a bit high considering we aren't in downtown, but it's a place we'll visit again.

reviews.author: Coby C.
reviews.description: Great selection of beer, wine and mead. The staff is very friendly. The environment is nice. We will be back next time we are in town. Thanks!

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: I loved the staff but they clearly don't want to pay for air conditioning!  Otherwise I would come back in a heartbeat!  Wine is great. They also offer beer, ciders and Mead!  If they don't realize that AC is important they won't be in business long!

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: Came out to Driftwood Tasting Room while we were on our winery "date day". We met the owner Lindsey and she was so sweet and knowledgeable. The venue is right of FM 150 in an industrial space with a great atmosphere. I highly recommend it for a date day, couples trip, or any kind of party. Locally owned and all products are sourced from Texas! Total perk -- super dog friendly!!

reviews.author: Susan D.
reviews.description: Hill Country Tasting Room is a wonderful find - I strongly recommend it! We rented out the entire venue for our rehearsal dinner, and it was absolutely perfect. We had ~50 people with an outside catered buffet dinner, and the venue was the perfect size - it still felt intimate during the speeches, but there was enough room for everyone to sit, eat, and mingle. The layout worked really well for us - for dinner, people could sit and eat on both the ground floor and mezzanine, and for speeches people mingled on the ground floor while the speeches were held on the landing. We love the atmosphere there - a combination of industrial, rustic, and chic that totally matched the vibe we were going for!  Planning was a breeze too - first Lindsey and then Deepa were both so accommodating and answered all our questions. Especially compared to some of the other venues I was talking to, Hill Country Tasting Room responded so quickly, kindly, and didn't mind when I asked a bunch of questions! I would definitely recommend them for hosting an event.  The drinks themselves were also amazing. We loved that it was all Texas beverages, and there were so many options! We were so glad to find a place that offered such a wide variety.  On the actual night of the rehearsal dinner, the bartenders were so helpful - I even got comments back from a couple of guests stating how nice they were! I can't wait until our next visit to the Dripping Springs area - we are definitely going back!

reviews.author: Joseph F.
reviews.description: Driftwood Tasting Room is tucked away in Driftwood, an oasis, but was a great stop! The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the selections they were carrying and they were able to make great recommendations based on our tastes. They have reasonable prices, they were in line with the other tasting rooms we had visited during the day. Their concept was awesome! Their selection is from local craft breweries and wineries and rotates between different companies. They also had the beverages available to take home if you found one, or more, you enjoyed.

reviews.author: E. A.
reviews.description: Two friends and I went to Driftwood Tasting Room and asked to do a wine tasting. The only employee there, Antonio, said the tasting would be $8 for four tastings. The menu had a long list of beer, mead, and cider as well as wine. We asked if we could mix and match the tastings between these drinks, and the employee said yes. We then asked, several times, if this would still be $8 for the tasting. He again said yes. When we went to pay, we discovered that our bill came out to more than twice that amount. Apparently, the tasting was not $8. He told my friends that we received full pours, and that's why it was more. Here's the thing, WE DIDNT ASK FOR FULL POURS; we asked for a tasting. The employee took it upon himself to give us the full pours, which we did not ask for and shouldn't have had to pay for. We left upset and confused as to what happened. One of my friends went back into the establishment to discuss a refund. We didn't want to all three go in and cause a scene, since the man was kind to us, we just wanted to remedy the situation. Apparently, he reexplained the full pours THAT WE DIDNT ASK FOR and then offered my friend $10 out of his pocket. She felt guilty about this and didn't ask for compensation for the other two of us that did a tasting. I repeat, tasting and not full pour. I'm not sure why he would offer us his own money instead of trying to correct the problem initially. Maybe he knew he was wrong? Or maybe he just wanted us to go away and not complain? I really don't know why he would do that. We discussed it more and felt upset about the whole situation and how it was awkwardly handled. It was a damper on what was supposed to be a nice day out. I decided to contact management through the Driftwood Tasting Room's Facebook page the next day to see if we could be fully refunded for the employee's mistake. I explained everything to the manager, Lindsey Pierce, who, of course defended the employee. I understand this, and I have nothing against the employee, but a mistake was made and I wanted it corrected. I didn't mention the $10, since it went to my friend who spoke to the employee. Apparently, this gave the manager reason to believe that I was lying. She said that my friends could contact her for a refund and I could get one after I returned the $10 cash, which I didn't even get, but ok.
