He is an awesome tour guide and a blast to hangout with and knows anyone and everyone! Can't recommend this tour enough!

reviews.author: Catherine T.
reviews.description: Woody was absolutely amazing , my boyfriend and I came into town Thursday 3/17/16 and I really wanted to find a tour for Friday . I called him Friday morning at 8:50 hoping I'd get a call back before the 10 am tour and I did ten min later and I was able to get on his first tour . I honestly called three or 4 more tours throughout the week and left messages and he is the only one that called me back. Not only did woody come through, he came through at the last minute when I thought We weren't going to make a tour.  He was funny , knowledgeable and overall a great guide. He even recommended a few things that weren't apart of the tour (Alamo Springs Cafe) which we ended up going to and was delicious.  Lunch was not included but the place we went to was pretty great for a sandwich . I'd hang out and grab a beer with woody any night !  Thank you for making my boyfriends birthday a good one !!

reviews.author: TC R.
reviews.description: Had an awesome day with my family and friends. Woody hit all the best spots and we got lit Woody is the man!

reviews.author: Rachael T.
reviews.description: I can't wait to get back to Fredricksburg and have Woody show me around! We had a large group of ladies and Woody took such great care of us. I would highly recommend his services to anyone heading to Fredricksburg!

reviews.author: Sue F.
reviews.description: Woody is a funny,helpful, kind and an amazing guy. We were able to book one day in advance. He responded to my call right away and set us up with a 4 person private tour plus lunch. We all had a great time with lots of funny narratives. If you want to see a different side of Texas wineries, just call Woody. He will definitely hook you up.  What a great day with no worries.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Woody was lovely and quickly became part of our group. He gave helpful insight into each winery and took so many pictures (patiently!) I wanted to dub him the class historian  Cannot recommend his services enough!

reviews.author: Nelcy R.
reviews.description: Woody was nice at the beginning but there was miscommunication about lunch and he decided to take it upon himself to charge my credit card without my permission. I was upset and apparently he was too so he threw customer service out the window. I never agreed to Woody keeping my credit card information on file after he charged the wine tour for 11 girls (almost $1,300).   The driver Tommy was nice but he did nothing special and didn't know the basics of Woody's business. Had he known even a little bit about Uncorked Tours, there wouldn't have been confusion about lunch.   As far as the wine tour: William Chris and Lost Draw were my favorite wineries. Hye Market pretended we weren't there half of the time. Pontotoc was greedy with their pours.   Woody was very unprofessional and difficult to work with at the end. I would not recommend him. Book early to get the highest rated wine tours (2-3 months prior)!

reviews.author: Shannon M.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our wine tour with Bill! He was very knowledgeable and easy to talk to since the other half of our tour cancelled, so it was like a private tour for my boyfriend and I.  We really enjoyed the entire time and highly recommend booking a wine tour through Uncorked!

reviews.author: Natalie A.
reviews.description: My friends and I went on a wine tour with Woody a few Sundays ago, and it was great! I tried to book for Saturday but the tour was full. I called the number provided on the website and had a great conversation with Woody. He set up the perfect private winery tour for me and my friends on Sunday, since Saturday was full. It was a really great and memorable experience and I would definitely consider doing it again! We had our own spacious limo that we could sip on wine we brought with us, as well as some we purchased at the wineries we visited, while driving from one vineyard to the next (drive time between each location was max. 15 minutes). Overall a great experience!

reviews.author: Brittany B.
reviews.description: We had such a great time with Woody! We were on a bachelorette trip with 15 ladies, and had plenty of room. He picked up our sandwich platters at H-E-B that morning, and set up a little outdoor picnic for us at the second winery. The bus was top of the line, he was a lot of fun, and we would definitely do it again!

reviews.author: Jonathan James R.
reviews.description: The night could not have gone any better. Vehicle was clean, music was perfect, and the service provided by the team was top notch. Any request that was made throughout the night was delivered on. I actually wish I could give 6 stars for a perfect evening.

reviews.author: Nick W.
reviews.description: George was amazing! We took went out to the Willam Chris Winery for the day and had the very best time going there and coming home with George. He is literally the best, nicest, and most fun driver we've had and will only use his services when we do trips like this. Thanks George!

reviews.author: Vinny P.
reviews.description: Great service! We did a brewery and distillery tour with Cool Bus ATX yesterday. Sam is the owner/driver and one thing she provides is unbelievable customer service. She's extremely easy to work with, provides a fun atmosphere on the bus and is very reasonable priced. I would highly recommend this service to anyone who's looking to get a group of friends together and tour around Austin.

reviews.author: Edwin T.
reviews.description: We had a 12 man bachelor party in Austin during Memorial Day weekend. The day we spent riding around in Cool Bus ATX was the absolute highlight of the weekend. Sam, the owner and driver, was unbelievable. Very accommodating, great driver, and super chill.   We planned to hit up the Salt Lick on the party bus and then venture around to some breweries afterwards. Sam made sure that the group got where we needed to be on time, had great suggestions for breweries, and made sure we were having as much fun as possible.  The bus is great. Fit everyone comfortably with enough room for a cooler in between all of us. Sam had her playlist turned up or she would hand over the AUX cord and we could play our tracks as loud as we wanted. The whole experience was incredibly laid back and worry free. I would absolutely recommend Cool bus ATX to anyone that wants to have a great time with a big group in Austin.   On a side note, if it is Sunday, make sure that you buy beer on Saturday because they don't sell it on Sunday before noon.   Thanks again, Sam!

reviews.author: Bailey S.
reviews.description: We just got back from an amazing weekend with Cool Bus ATX!! Sam, the owner, is very sweet and accommodating. The bus itself is awesome - lights, music (you can play your own music too!), plenty of seating, very well maintained and clean. Would recommend to everyone. Thanks again Cool Bus ATX!

reviews.author: Shani S.
reviews.description: What a wonderful time!  As a bachelorette "day party," we gathered together and hopped in the super roomy and comfortable All About Central Texas SUV and headed out on our journey.   Kim is extremely knowledgeable about each winery; the history, the best wines to try, the "wine club" or other bonus things each winery has.   We stopped in on 3 different wineries and Kim had made superb choices in each spot; from the wines to the view to the suggestions on what to try and how to make the most of our samples so everyone could try as many as possible (thanks for that tip, Kim!).   Be it an afternoon with a group of friends, or a romantic day for two, All About Central Texas is an outstanding choice.  Thanks for everything, Kim!

reviews.author: Donna D.
reviews.description: All about Central Texas was really great- Kim was so knowledgeable about the area and had great info on wine and Texas! I did the Fredericksburg tour and based on my wine preferences she had some great suggestions on which ones to stop in, there are so many! I even joined a wine club, the tastings were informative and she is just a lot of fun and I didn't have to worry about driving or directions and could enjoy the pours and some snacks.  I highly recommend All abt Central Texas tours, they are personable, you can really get to meet the others in these small groups- Thanks so much!

reviews.author: Candy B.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb are an amazing duo. Very personable and easy to work with. They aim to exceed your wildest wine tour expectations! The transportation (van) was very clean and well-taken care of. We had the van to ourselves on the couple's tour but it can easily fit a big party!  Booking a couple's wine tour on their website was super easy (and I'm sure it would be for big groups too)! The date availability, cost estimate, and customizability is spot-on. The moment you book, they send you a comprehensive list of wineries and distilleries (!!!) with rankings of the view + wine. They also have great options for add-ons, such as a charcuterie board or stopping by for lunch mid-wine tour. Love that.  There's no doubt I would choose and recommend 830 Elevated again for any future wine excursions in Hill Country. Thanks again, Brayden and Deb :)

reviews.author: Emily H.
reviews.description: WOW....Just WOW!!!!  We had so much fun celebrating my sisters bachelorette weekend in Fredericksburg and 830 Elevated Wine Tours exceeded all of our expectations!!!  Deb (co-owner and our tour guide) was absolutely AMAZING and she made sure that we had everything we needed!!!  Seriously can't wait to book again next time we are in Fredericksburg and we have already decided it needs to be a yearly trip for us!   They were so informative and helpful with picking out which vineyards would be best for us and answered all of my questions quickly and with helpful details and suggestions!!

reviews.author: Viviana V.
reviews.description: 840 were so easy to work with from website to actual tour. We had the most courteous tour guide Brandon! He was a gem and treated us well! Will book with them again!

reviews.author: Nicole Y.
reviews.description: We had the absolute BEST time with Brayden on our tour. From start to finish everything was so easy and customizable to what we were looking for while planning our annual girls trip. Prices are incomparable with Five Star treatment on a PRIVATE tour. Right after booking we got an email with a list of the area wineries and restaurants that had notes and ratings so we could choose where we wanted to go. This is a private tour so Brayden picked us up right in front of our Airbnb and we were off. We toured four wineries and he kept us on schedule but never rushing us. After the tours we opted for the night service so he dropped us off on Main Street so we could grab dinner, sing some karaoke and when ready to be picked up to end the evening just had to shoot him a text and he was there. We just cannot say enough good things about this company. Do not second guess - book with Brayden and Deb

reviews.author: Kim M.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb did a FANTASTIC job hosting our small girls group! They offer private tours for the same price most other charge to fill up a limo or bus. They were on time and very accommodating, went as far as going to buy a stool for my friend who has trouble getting up and down the steps to the van. The wineries they took us to were exactly what we asked for. We never felt rushed and they handled everything for us and we never had to lift a finger to do anything. I would 100% recommend them and will definitely be using them again!

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: I came across 830 when our bed and breakfast cancelled our room and wine tour reservation (due to remodeling) a month before our 10 year anniversary trip to Fredericksburg. I believe they were on the city website as a recommended tour, but also Google directed me to them. Either way, I am so glad it happened this way - our experience with 830 was indeed elevated!!! The customized tour that Deb set up with me over the phone was exactly what my husband and I wanted - a distillery, a brewery, and a winery that made you feel like you were in Napa. Without even knowing us, Deb helped picked the perfect places for us to enjoy. Communication up until the tour and the day of the tour was prompt and courteous, always with our best intentions in mind (example: Deb texted us and offered to pick us up even earlier than planned due to the heat at one of the outdoor locations). The drive in between locations was full of great conversation, and we were thankful they provided cold water for us. The van was immaculate and the drive was very comfortable - I didn't know the luxury that a private vs public tour would offer! Deb was so knowledgeable (she's a local, of course!) and so sweet with helping us newbies figure out what to do. Her service went above and beyond, and she made us feel like celebrities. It was an absolute pleasure to work with them - do yourself the best favor and book with them!!

reviews.author: Kristin D.
reviews.description: We had a group of 10 girls book a wine tour through 830 Elevated this past weekend, and I could not more highly recommend this company!! They made the trip so easy, worry-free, and fun! Brayden and Deb were super communicative and gave us a wide variety of wineries to choose from. We ended up going to Baron's Creek, Signor, and Augusta Vin. Deb was our tour guide and took care of absolutely everything and was such a joy to be around. If you are headed to Fredericksburg and wanting to visit the wineries, you won't regret choosing to book through 830 Elevated!!

reviews.author: Kristen W.
reviews.description: We toured Fredericksburg with Brayden and he was very friendly, knowledgeable, and flexible with our requests. We were able to customize our winery stops which was not the experience we had previously with a different wine tour company. We spent the day with our group of four instead of getting shuttled around with strangers to fill seats (which I really prefer)! We requested a charcuterie board in the vehicle and Brayden picked it up while we were at one of our stops. We will definitely be back and use 830 Elevated for all of our future trips!

reviews.author: Pierre P.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb were amazing! We will for sure book with them in the future. They made the whole wine touring and tasting experience so easy. Great conversations and excellent customer service. If you are going to go Wine Tasting in Fredericksburg, BOOK WITH THEM!

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: My friends planned a bachelorette weekend for me that included the wine tour with 830 wine tours. We had such a blast and everything was above and beyond our expectations! Each stop was beautiful and the tastings were great! This was the highlight Of our trip! The owners are super nice and accommodated all of our requests and even had good suggestions for things to do and place to eat! We absolutely love them!! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Jonathan Y.
reviews.description: I like their hustle. Wife and I wanted a private custom tour (because COVID). But the best we could find was a limo driver that would charge us almost what it would for 4 people. Then we found 830 Elevated. They're filling a niche most tour companies aren't by providing an affordable private tour option for couples. They were great. Small, young company. They don't have deep knowledge on wine like veteran companies but they are personable in that they also tour wineries themselves and can share their inputs.

reviews.author: Casey C.
reviews.description: The worst experience. Here's my story-   I booked with this company over a month in advance prior to my trip to Fredericksburg for my fianc and I's anniversary, as well as his birthday. After booking, the company was very communicative for the first few days. After the first few days, I did not hear a word from them until the week of our trip. I had told them a month in advance which places we wanted to go. The week of, they inform us that Augusta vin is not taking people for reservations. Which was fine, we went ahead with the other vineyard they had suggested. We had booked for a Saturday. That Friday at 3:00AM, they had informed us of a change of driver due to a family emergency which we completely understood, and now that our pickup time had changed to 11:30AM instead of 1:30PM. I wake up to that email Saturday still understanding, and we changed our plans to be at the pickup destination by 11:30AM. We are waiting there over 15 minutes for them to show, and no one does. We call, leave voicemails, and still hear from no one. 30 minutes passed, they send a TEXT MESSAGE informing us they aren't showing up for the entire time and that we are on our own for the entire day. LEAVING OUR PLANS FOR THE ENTIRE DAY RUINED. Incredibly horrid communication from this company. DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!!!! I seriously am understanding that situations happen in life, but they had guaranteed us a driver for the day regardless of what had happened. I was truly heartbroken to have not received a personal phone call from the company, instead they just send us a text that they are not coming. I have NEVER written a review for a company before, but this needed to be shared. We discussed the situation with multiple locals in the town, no one had ever heard of this company. Whatever you do, save your money and time.

reviews.author: Ansley C.
reviews.description: We had a group of 13 trying to get out to a few wine tastings to celebrate a birthday and I am so glad I reached out to David, the owner of Open Range Tours. He was quick to respond and helped me schedule a party bus big enough for all of us. David, our driver, showed up early and made sure we had everything we needed for the trip. He had a giant cooler with ice and waters that we were able to load up with seltzers. I booked our wineries ahead of time which made getting into the tastings a breeze. David made sure we got to each winery on time and went in ahead to ensure each winery was ready for us when we arrived. He even coordinated to have the band at one of the wineries sing Happy Birthday! David was absolutely fantastic, and we had a great time with him. We will definitely be booking with them again for our next trip. I highly recommend Open Range Tours to anyone visiting Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Anjelah L.
reviews.description: My family and friends booked this tour for my birthday. We had 10 people in the bus and we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our driver, David was AWESOME!! He had great recommendations and kept us (somewhat) on our schedule! He was a blast! Bus was super roomy and had everything we needed! We will be back and booking with open range again tours again!

reviews.author: J P.
reviews.description: What a great experience!  The 2 Davids were great. We booked this last minute due to the recent snow/ice storm and they were very flexible. We started at William Chris, headed to Pedernales and ended at Augusta Vin. The 15 passenger van was great for our group of 11. They offered water and took care of checking us in at each winery. David was a complete gentleman and carried all of our purchases and secured them in the van while we enjoyed our time tasting the different wines. He even dropped us off downtown so we would be on time for our dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: I had a driver cancel on me 3 days before my trip. David was so friendly and squeezed in my group through a cancellation he had. He was so nice and really helped us out!!

reviews.author: Lisa D.
reviews.description: David was extremely instrumental in getting a wine tour pulled together, despite many places being shut down (or car-to-go only) due to the latest covid orders. We enjoyed his friendly banter, nice and clean van, and all of the places we went. Will definitely book with David again.

reviews.author: Lauren C.
reviews.description: Absolutely gorgeous day out and about with our guide Mark-he even took us to see the bats after three totally different experiences tasting frozen sangria, fine local wines and tasty beer selection which took us back to Germany! Each location they chose for us was better than the next. Thank you so much for taking us out on a Bad Moms Tour

reviews.author: Tanya R.
reviews.description: You can't go wrong in chosing this company for your tour. David was our guide and he was fabulous. He was very helpful in picking out which vineyards to go to. He did everything possible to ensure we had a great time. Even helped me with getting the best cake ever for a surprise.  You will be very happy!! We will definitely be back! Thanks for everything!!

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Excellent company! Highly recommend! They were prompt and so accommodating for our party. Tour driver even went and picked up lunch for us while we were wine tasting. Don't hesitate to use them for your transportation needs!

reviews.author: Shannon Z.
reviews.description: Open Range tours was perfect for our bachelorette wine tour. David was professional and personable. He cared that we were safe and having fun. Once our tour, extended an extra hour, drew to an end, David even recommended transportation for our evening fun. Would definitely recommend Open Range tours and will contact them for future visits.

reviews.author: Keith H.
reviews.description: Open Range Tours is a great company. We've had the owner, David, several times, and we've never been disappointed. He cares about his clients, and goes out of the way to make sure their experience in the wine country is the best it can be. We've used him so much, that we will never use another company when we're in the region. You can't do any better than Open Range, trust me.

reviews.author: Nicole N.
reviews.description: "Double Pimp D" aka David was absolutely phenomenal.  We had a group of 13 in San Antonio go wine tasting in fberg for the day.  He picked us up from San Antonio, drove us up to Hill Country and around to 3 wineries.  As this was my first Texas wine tour, he did an AMAZING job of helping us select which wineries would be a good fit for the group.  As we had a decent amount of guys with us- he suggest Garrison Brother's Distillery which ended up being a HUGE hit!  He was extremely professional, courteous and just an absolute delight to spend the day with!  He also has a wicked funny sense of humor.  He was also very accommodating and ordered and picked up lunch for us so we could continue to enjoy beautiful Hill Country.  I would use him again in heartbeat and highly, highly recommend him to anyone wanting to enjoy Texas Hill Country!  Thanks David!

reviews.author: Amye B.
reviews.description: Do NOT recommend! We booked a tour for 8 people and everything was a mess from the beginning. We were told we would be upgraded to a 15 passenger bus. A 15 passenger VAN showed up with a dent in the side and ripped seats. We were told we could bring coolers. We were only able to fit 8 adults in the van with our two coolers- no way we could've had another person in the van. None of the wineries had been scheduled yet and the ONE we had specifically requested was not available. We had to scramble ourselves to find wineries, in which we were promised everything would be done ahead of time. The meat and cheese tray that was promised was a small tray that was bought during the tour at a convenient store to feed 2 people. Our driver was great, however the owner did not deliver what was promised and we were highly disappointed. There are plenty of companies to choose from, and I would NOT recommend Open Range.

reviews.author: B M.
reviews.description: David was very helpful in planning a last minute wine tour. He was attentive in making sure we had a great day! He picked places that were just right for what we wanted. Our driver, Lyn, made the day seamless and easy by being flexible and friendly. I would definitely use them again.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Used David for my wedding at the Lodge and Country Inn Cottages. They had great communication and made the wedding a breeze. Would absolutely recommend them to do a wedding again. Thanks David!

reviews.author: Dustin M.
reviews.description: David is the man! My wife and I had such a great experience. He took us all over wine country. He had great stories and knew all the great places to go. We will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Marge B.
reviews.description: I arranged a Girls' Getaway to Fredericksburg, so naturally I wanted to do a wine tour. I contacted several tour companies. D'Ann was extremely responsive and gave me several suggestions of where to go. Since I'm a wine club member at quite a few wineries in the Hill Country, I opted to do a custom tour and made my own reservations. Greg, the owner (and D'Ann's husband) arrived on time and drove us to 3 wineries where we were able to enjoy a nice, relaxing afternoon. Greg was so friendly, helpful and accommodating. I would highly recommend Open Range Tours...thanks, D'Ann and Greg!!!

reviews.author: Casey F.
reviews.description: D'ann went above and beyond for the tour for my sister's bachelorette party!  There were some general issues with scheduling and logistics that were my fault, but she very kindly fixed everything!  Our driver David was on time, helpful, and a lot of fun.  They know a lot about the wineries and have personal relationships with the owners/managers/tasting staff.  David also went above and beyond by making an extra stop for shopping/pie-indulging and by dropping us off at our dinner restaurant so we didn't have to walk from the visitor center where he picked us up.  Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: My winery tour with open range was excellent. D'anne took great care of my group. She texted me several times to keep me updated on the tour and even gave me her personal cell number so that I could reach her anytime. Our driver, Bill, was right on time. He was knowledgeable and very friendly. I highly recommend them for your next tour.

reviews.author: Holly P.
reviews.description: We went to Fredericksburg for a girls trip and wanted to spend a day at the distilleries and breweries. David was fantastic to work with planning everything out. I wouldn't have changed any of that part. But, once the day rolled around we were met with a hiccup. The driver, not David like I was anticipating after multiple conversations, arrived in a mustang for 5 of us. Obviously that wasn't going to work so I was offered by the driver only to cancel or reschedule. Our trip was planned around spending our day out and about so cancelling wasn't an option for us. After a phone call to David, we were assured our day wasn't ruined just a bit delayed. The driver left and showed back up with an SUV and away we went. The driver wasn't interactive and she didn't seem to even be having a good day... It happens I get it but come on. Anyway, we made the best of our day and enjoyed ourselves. When we were dropped off, I tried to pay but she said to get with David. No problem but I did have a problem with her then saying that she'd go ahead and take the gratuity and that the standard is 20%. I didn't even know what our total cost was to figure 20% but asking for the gratuity before I even paid for the day was in poor taste. We did go ahead and tip, and well mind you, because that's the kind of people we are. I ended up calling David and finishing out the transaction and once again, he was a pleasure to deal with. Overall, we'll use them again because I appreciated David that much. But, I'll definitely make sure we don't have the same driver. 5 stars for David but 4 stars overall for the above mentioned.

name: Yellow Rose of Texas Wine Tours

reviews.author: Patti A.
reviews.description: Everything was great!  John, the owner was super cool.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: This business is run by a single creep who deceives his clients and thinks he can because it's "his business", even though what was PAID for was denied to us. He is running the business with very unprofessional interactions with his customers and partnering wineries. I would NOT recommend using this company.

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: I booked Yellow Rose 1 month out and had great communication with John, the owner. He ended up being our driver on our own private bus for a 40th birthday trip with 4 crazy girls. He was at our beck and call and did not complain once. We had 3 wine tour stops and then Luckenbach, and it was soooo fun!  All 3 places were each different than the other which gave us a great variety. Thank you John for a wonderful time!

reviews.author: M W.
reviews.description: Our group had a fabulous day with John at Yellow Rose Wine Tours!! It was so relaxing to sit back and enjoy the day with friends, all while knowing every detail had been taken care of.  This coming from a very "type A" personality is a huge 5 star! We did the "red rose" package, touring 3 wineries and had a few hours in Luckenbach.  John was friendly, fun and a great host. All we had to do is drink wine, visit with friends and enjoy the day! If you are looking for a fun experience, try Yellow Rose! We will be back next year to do it all over again!

reviews.author: Sasha F.
reviews.description: Do not use this "tour"!! It is cheaper to pay the tasting fees and hire your own driver. The owner is greedy and a complete A. We originally had 5 ladies who were going on the tour with us and one backed out. We didn't ask for a private tour and John (who I'm guessing is the owner) didn't tell us until we were already at the first location that he would stop the tour until we paid for a fifth person that wasn't there. No wonder he kept pushing cash, it was a complete rip off. It was either go home after that tour paying $125 a person..Or have two more tours while paying for a person who wasn't there. PS it's about $15 for the wine tastings. ($15x3=$45) It was not worth it. On a positive note, Gary at Hanhe Estates winery was amazing. Highly recommend this guy and his wine.

reviews.author: Michaela S.
reviews.description: A couple friends and I decided to go on the White Rose package and had a blast. We visited 2 wineries, a distillery, and a brewery. Our driver, John, was great. He made our experience in the Hill Country one to remember. He was very friendly and kept us on schedule without making us feel rushed. Overall we had a great day and would definitely book again!

reviews.author: Tiffany K.
reviews.description: We were very pleased with John our driver and Cindy's understanding of the wineries.  John helped us learn more about the area and really did a great job accommodating everyone.  Some of us picked up lunch and we ate it at the Fat Ass winery which I would highly recommend. Water was provided and the options at each winery covered all tastes.

reviews.author: Jordan H.
reviews.description: "Tour" is an awfully strong word. We were picked up and then drove for 45 minutes without our driver, John, saying a word about where we were going or how long it would take to get there. He then picked up 3 other people when it was supposed to be a private tour. He took us to the wineries but never said a word about where to go or what to do. He followed us around at the wineries and sat with us. He was 30 minutes late then forgot what the schedule was supposed to be and tried to keep us at the 2nd winery until 30 minutes after we were supposed to be home. He told us we could pay with cash or card, but he only actually took cash or PayPal, which put some people in a real bind. He hounded us about payment the whole time. It was awful and we will never do it again.

reviews.author: Orlando L.
reviews.description: Had a really great time, would definitely recommend. They did a great job with the event and everything went very smoothly and the price was way better than most other services.

reviews.author: Mackenzie W.
reviews.description: I rented a party bus through this company a couple weeks ago. In the beginning, Robert was extremely accommodating and friendly. And our driver, Terrell, was great. We got dropped off at COTA for a show and had a great time!  But where it turned south was at the end of the night. I texted our driver 30 minutes before we needed to be picked up (like he requested) and he said no problem. Then we left the concert and were walking to the pickup spot where I gave him a call. He said he got in an accident but would only be 20 minutes and I said that's fine. 20 minutes roll by and I gave him a call again, no answer, but texted and said it would be another 20 minutes. We ended up waiting in the cold for almost an hour and well after most people had left COTA. Multiple people in our party ended up just taking ubers because they didn't want to wait. The whole point of a bus is so you don't have to wait.  The next day, I texted Robert saying we would like a refund for the extra hour we paid for waiting that we wouldn't have used if we had been picked up on time. He said he would call to discuss but never did. I've now sent him multiple emails - mind you, being incredibly nice about it. All I asked for was an hour refunded back - not the whole thing, not even half. But still no response.  The customer service level of this company is terrible should anything go wrong. So hire them at your own risk.

reviews.author: Neesh S.
reviews.description: Apologies for this review being so incredibly late but Austin Nites was the best! We had rented a party bus on pretty short notice to take a Bachelor Party to and from Lake Travis and Robert and team were amazing.   It was also Prom weekend so the schedule was packed for them but they still took care of us and worked with our schedule.   Our boat ended up staying out on the water longer than scheduled which through our plans all over the place and Robert was there waiting on time. Given his packed schedule, the driver did have to leave without us but Robert made sure to get me in contact with another service and they sent a bus over right away.   All in all, it was an incredible experience!

reviews.author: Snl H.
reviews.description: For $700+ for four hours we would have expected a better looking bus. Multiple dents around outside of bus. The AC barely working. Missing panels inside of bus missing or duct tape together.  Another party bus parked next to the one we had and it was so obvious how terrible looking our bus looked.   Can't believe owners would let this bus represent their company. Hope they use our $700 toward getting it fixed.   Driver was pleasant.

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: Fist off I'm hyper paranoid about drinking and driving so I usually use Uber, Lyft etc to get around town when I wanna go out and when I'm probably going to have a few drinks! But how is that supposed to work when you have a huge group? I called austin nites party rentals for a few reasons 1. I love puns and 2. I'm am austinite and 3. My group was over ten people and we wanted to go out and have nothing to worry about. Great party bus, great personable driver, great experience definitely reccomend these guys!! DONT DRINK AND DRIVE!! Call someone you can trust call Austin Nites!!

reviews.author: Charli R.
reviews.description: I'm incredibly frustrated with this business.  We had spoken a couple times in the months before I decided to book and I initially felt great about potentially booking with these friendly people.  When it came time to book I called them and was told, once again, that our requested date was open and we talked out an agreement.  The owner tells me we're good to go, and that all he needed me to do now was to send him my information so that he could get a contract sent that same day.  I'd explained to him that I was booking this bus ride to and from a party boat, and that I would be booking with them that day as well.   SO, I get off the phone and send my info.  I call my party boat folks to let them know I've just confirmed my bus, and I'm ready for a boat.  I book with them based on my discussion with these guys and put down $400 to hold our reservation.  It's been two weeks since I last spoke with this company and they have ignored my calls, texts, voicemails trying to figure out why the contract hasn't come through.  Our event is next month, and at this point I've been researching new solutions, and unfortunately the new solution means I can't use the same boat company, and therefore I've lost my $400 deposit.  I did not have this money to lose, but after being ghosted by this company I guess I have to take the loss and move on.  They seem like nice people, and it takes A LOT to get on here and write a negative review, but this has caused me a lot of stress and I want to prevent this from happening to anyone else.  I hope at some point I find out a reasonable explanation and can revise this review, but not counting on it.  We'll see I guess.

reviews.author: Horacio R.
reviews.description: BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!  Robert did a solid job taking me and a bunch of my friends to Lake Travis and back on July 4th. His price was WAY lower than other companies I called, being the ONLY one that actually sticked to his regular prices during this busy day. He arrived early and was 100% responsive to my emails and phone calls. He arrive early to pick us up and was extremely friendly and professional. He helped us carry our coolers and accommodate everything on the bus.  The bus itself is amazing. Seats are stacked in two rows facing each other, which is great for dancing and socializing, since you are actually facing half of the crowd. The sound system is also very good. I almost feel that the bus trip was even more fun that the boat.   In summary, Austin Nites Ent. is the best on price/quality, Robert and his wife are responsive, professional and friendly, and the whole experience I had with them is positive. Would highly recommend anyone to use it, and will definitely consider using them again if I ever need to.  Thank you guys!!!!!

reviews.author: Lisa K.
reviews.description: What a great experience!  Driver was super awesome, the speakers were great and the bus was clean!!!!  We will definitely use them again!

reviews.author: Jerrod G.
reviews.description: They call you and say the bus is available and ask for a deposit over the phone.  But when we asked for a contract they go dark and won't respond. Their reviews are all their friends so not sure if this is a legitimate small business or not. There is another review on Facebook similar to our situation and she confirmed to us they went dark on her too.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: Great experience with Austin Nites! Robert and Melissa were super helpful, accommodating, on-time (actually, early) and friendly! Would definitely use again.

reviews.author: A H.
reviews.description: I have used Austin Nites for the last 5 years and Robert the owner does not disappoint. They are punctual, courteous and very reasonably priced. We have had many fun events on the Big Blue Bus (UT games, holiday and birthday parties) and Robert always comes away with new clients. I highly recommend Austin Nites for any event that requires transporting a group. The bus ride will be the best part of your event!

reviews.author: David A.
reviews.description: I was down in austin with 19 other guys and we needed transportation for the entire night.  Robert was a great communicator before we got to austin and before he picked us up.  He was 15 minutes early, and had the bus stocked with ice, etc.  The bus was really nice, and perfect for a night out on the town.  Would definitely use this service again!

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: For my daughters birthday/last school dance we booked service with Austin Nites Party Bus.  From booking the ride up until the end of the night everything went as planned.  Our driver, Jared, was professional and so great to the girls and I during the time he drove us around.  The owners, Robert and Melissa, promptly returned my calls/texts with any questions I had before the night of the booking. The fee for the evening was wonderfully priced compared to other companies I had called around and gotten quotes from.  I highly recommend Austin Nites Party Bus based on my experience with them.

reviews.author: Sybil E.
reviews.description: We rented a party bus from Robert for my brother's 30th birthday. They were one of the only companies I found that didn't increase their rates because of prom season. I called about 10 other companies looking for fun and safe travels with almost all of them being ridiculously overpriced to take advantage of the prom goers. Robert was very accommodating, professional, and had awesome rates. He called two days before the scheduled time of arrival to check in and verify everything was still good to go. He asked if there were any changes in the amount of people and offered a bigger bus just in case. Our drivers, Patrick and Joe were awesome! Patrick called me early the day of to verify everything and let me know he'd be there at 8 and then called again when they were almost to our pickup location. They arrived right on time with an awesome bus just for us. He had coolers with ice, a flat screen tv, music system, AC and even a bathroom in the back. What more could you ask for? Part of the evening was spent at Graham's Central Station in Pville. We didn't realize prior that Graham's doesn't serve food anymore and had to order pizza to the bus. Patrick gladly retrieved our pizza and brought it to us when it arrived. We all had a blast, felt safe and were taken care of. Highly recommend Austin NItes and shout out to Patty PartyWagon, if you had a Yelp page, I'd write a review for you too.

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: WARNING: We had a tight deadline to get to Lake Travis and the bus driver was 30 minutes late.  We had to take another bus or risk missing our charter.  He verbally offered to refund my money for his tardiness and then kept my funds and would not return them.  Now I am fighting to get those funds back.  LOOK ELSEWHERE.

reviews.author: Peter S.
reviews.description: Take a venture off the main road through the countryside of the Texas Hill Country on rough roads through the forest over creeks to a beautiful vineyard covered meadow and keep going up the hill to the terrace overlooking the field and stream below. You'll have a great time.

reviews.author: Sylvia R.
reviews.description: We chose this winery because we saw a 5star review but found that it wasn't all that. They only offered wine tasting and no tour. The wine selection was rated at 2.5 with a group five of us. However, we highly recommend Wimberley Valley Winery. Very spontaneous, staff was very welcoming and the wine tasting was amazing.

reviews.author: Arely G.
reviews.description: We visited on a Saturday they had live music on a patio that overlooks the vineyard with a Beautiful view. Service was amazing and the wine was great .

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: New winery, family owned and run. Limited selection of tasting to 3 that were made of Texas plains grapes but they were all good wines. The biggest attraction, which will guarantee they'll be successful is the view and gorgeous setting. They put a large deck on the hill so you can enjoy your wine while looking out at the vineyard.

reviews.author: Hilda S.
reviews.description: The views are breathtaking, the wines are fantastic and staff are very friendly. From the whites to ros and reds, the wines are delightful. Likes them so much that I became a wine club member. Looking forward to returning and introducing friends to this winery.

reviews.author: Caroline B.
reviews.description: Wonderful place with some great wines! The staff was delightful and friendly. The place wasn't too crowded but they just opened in November and I think people are going to be learning about this place and packing it out very soon!   They grow grapes on the property but all the wine I had was outsourced since their weren't ready yet. They had three wines to try (white, rose and red) but will be having six very soon as their home grown grapes are about ready. I enjoy dry, less sweet wines and these were perfect. Highly encourage you to put this spot on your wine tours of Wimberly! They also have some snacks/small bites if you are hungry.

reviews.author: Linda A.
reviews.description: This is a "Hidden Gem"!!! What a wonderful winery!!! We went relatively early to avoid any crowd and the staff were welcoming and informative.  They now have 4 wines and all of them were delicious. I'm not a sweet wine drinker and gratefully none of them were sweet. One crisp white, 2 ross and a red. We left with a bottle of the red and one of the ross too. The property and views are beautiful. They have two decks with tables and umbrellas to relax and enjoy the wine, the views, the weather and a fabulous charcuterie platter. It is a bit tricky getting there BUT it is well worth it. Don't miss this delightful vineyard!

reviews.author: Lizi P.
reviews.description: Beautiful and quaint, a smaller winery and much more intimate. Sipping wine on the large patio deck overlooking the vineyard made for a perfect early afternoon.  Charcuterie  was most generous for two ladies that love cheese and their gorgeous white blends, a new favorite spot to be revisited!! Somaliere Darryl was most delightful, definitely knew how to relate the flavors of their wine and listened to accommodate our palate.  Love this spot as would Bacchus!!  Thank you so very much Limestone!!

reviews.author: Kaitlin Z.
reviews.description: Owners were very welcoming and friendly. Wine was great and snacks were so tasty! They had fun games and beautiful places to hang out on the property. Definitely will return.

reviews.author: Dont W.
reviews.description: Good food, friendly staff, and interesting products. It also has a great selection of craft beers on tap.

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: The olives!  This place is a fun foodie shop right on the beautiful Wimberley Square. It looks like it might have been a gas station or something at some time, but you can tell that they've spent a lot of time and effort to making it an appealing place to learn about new flavors. When I went, they were celebrating National Paella Day, and had lots of little Spanish flags everywhere. (I would've appreciated a Catalonian flag in there, but let's not get political with the paella.) The clerk patiently explained to the visitors what paella was, and seemed attentive and on the ball. The store also sells paella kits, with a dish, pimenton, bomba rice, some saffron- everything you need for a paella party!  My favorite thing about this place is all the pickled, canned stuff they have- crazy olives with wild stuffings in them from all over Texas, and some from abroad. They also have hot sauces and fun things to take home to show how we do it in Texas.  There's also a wine desk, where they'll pour you a glass of something good. They focus heavily on Texas wines, and if you ask me, the reds are where it's at. Really, the Texas red varietals of wine go quite well with Spanish food- they're similar grapes, I believe.  We skipped out on having lunch here, but really enjoyed the merchandise they had and the vibe of the place. It seems that part of it is still under construction, and they aim to expand.  Be sure to check out the real live olive tree out front!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: We were so excited to check out a new place in Wimberley, and we'd heard such great things about the Buda location but....yikes, we will definitely not be returning, sadly.  We walked in around 1pm hoping for a simple lunch- we only ordered one sandwich and two sides. An hour later, we finally had all of our items :( she packed it to go for us since I told her we'd been waiting so long and my fianc had to get back to work. If they had told us about the crazy wait time before we ordered, we would've appreciated the heads up so much. It was confusing to us since it didn't seem busy at all- she told us they were understaffed. I guess that might also explain why it took so long for anyone to acknowledge us when we stood at the counter- we had already ordered but had to go back for water, napkins etc (no one came and checked on us or anything). The girl at the counter just went about her business and seemed to be ignoring us...  After all that, if the food had been amazing, that could've been a saving grace but, unfortunately, it was ...just ok? What a bizarre experience. Maybe we came at a bad time - I hope they get properly staffed soon!

reviews.author: Alicia A.
reviews.description: Rude. I get that you're busy, understaffed, spring break...but...don't lie about food take 45 min. When it takes over an hour and 20 min to get pimento cheese! Don't tell me the burger is on the grill and it comes out 25 min later. Don't ignore me when I ask if I can have a drink with my food "when you get the chance" (politely) and you continue to roll silverware and then disappear in the kitchen only to come back on your phone texting.  -no napkins given -no silverware given -no check backs -no drinks (or refills) offered No sincere apologies or recompense made either. Just excuses, irritation and ignoring.

reviews.author: Cris F.
reviews.description: There was 4 in our group. We were each served our meal one at a time after a very long wait. Our appetizer arrived after we had finished eating and did not even look edible. We asked for a refund and we're told that was not allowed. We have eaten here before and had the best burger and fries. This time the burgers and fries were not the same and my husband didn't even get his fries until the appetizer arrived when we were leaving. Food was terrible and service was even worse. The owner told us no refunds if he really was the owner. Just terrible!!!

reviews.author: Monica R.
reviews.description: Wanted to like this place because it has an appealing look.  Walking in, it isn't clear if one orders at the counter or at the table.  Three employees behind the counter and not one had a greeting or smile to offer.  Just blank faces.  There were four customers at one table so it wasn't like the restaurant was busy.  After asking about how ordering works, we ordered two entrees.   After about 20 minutes, one entree arrived.  We split it in half and after finishing it, another employee came and asked if he could clear our plates.  We said we were still waiting for the second entree.  No reaction.  My boyfriend said, " could you please go check? If it hasn't been started, don't start it now." The employee said, okay.  Five minutes later and no update.  We decided to cut our losses.  Head up to pay at the counter. Three employees standing there again.  We tell them we are done and please take the second entree off the bill. One employee says alright and the scowliest female, who never spoke or assisted previously, says, " it's ready now so you have to pay." Nope. We will not be returning. Every recent review is similar to this one and that tells me that no one cares.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here for wine tasting. You choose 5 different ones for $11, making this one of the more affordable options around this area. It comes out on a wooden board with stemless glasses. It would have been nicer if the servers gave a bit more description about each of the wines, but they were all very enjoyable.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: The customer service was amazing!  We were treated like family and enjoyed our experience tremendously.

reviews.author: Haley C.
reviews.description: Literally so good! We were the only people in there on a Monday just before close and the service was great. It was even happy hour and we didn't even know it! The wine tasting was great and a GREAT value during happy hour.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Meh. It was nothing special. No ambiance. Service was decent. Food was delicious. But overall the experience was just normal.

reviews.author: Eric P.
reviews.description: Ac, Texas tasty wines and friendly people.  What else can you ask for ?   We worth the $11 sampling price.

reviews.author: Oscar S.
reviews.description: Great place just to get away and have a good brew. Great wine stop... nice people nice atmosphere!! Thank you

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Nice place to sit and cool off in Wimberley. They have tons of wine samples, drinks and some small appetizers. Plus a wall full of snacks and specialty foods to bring home for that special occasion. I spun the way back wheel and got some pickled eggs. I made it normal (kind of) by adding some flavored pecans.

reviews.author: Carole B.
reviews.description: Totally disappointed.  Asked for a menu...ordered a bottle of wine and 10 minutes later we go to order food to be told the kitchen is closed!!!  Really at 7:40?  You couldn't tell us that before wine was bought!?  So we get to sit there and drink wine while everyone around us are eating.  Never again!

reviews.author: Chelsea G.
reviews.description: This place is a must! Super cute wine shop/country store with a very chill vibe. We did a wine tasting and a cheese plate and everything was perfect! We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Taste Buds is a cool little shop located in the tourist town of Wimberley, TX. It has been taken over my new owners and it had a name change, but most of what the former owners carried is still available, though some things are not; however, the new owners do offer some new things. They do offer some beers and wines, but my biggest interest is the hot sauces, salsa's, and pickles. They do offer some free samples and if you're not a chili head like me, be careful as the ghost pepper and the scorpion salsa's offer a very quick and very hot bite that will get your attention !!!!

reviews.author: Luis D.
reviews.description: Great little charcuterie board with good ambience and delicious drinks. This place is worth the trip to Wimberley!

reviews.author: Joey M.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this place when we arrived in town and really glad we did. They serve tons of Texas wine and do wine tastings too. The other half of the building is stocked with cool Texas made dips and jarred goods. Our server was so nice and was easy to talk to! Also, we really appreciated that they were dog friendly! Overall a great place it's stop and check out while you're in Wimberley.

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: LOVE this place!! The food and drink selection was fabulous! So excited for Buda!! I would like it if the employees wore their masks correctly though. One didn't have one at all, but had gloves and the others had them almost covering their mouths, but not their noses. Soon there will be a vaccine, but until then... please.

reviews.author: Joanna R.
reviews.description: Our first time here and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Quaint, welcoming stop before we walked around. Perfect place to stop in and relax, enjoy a glass, and a small bite to eat. Thank you Los Olivos for being a part of my Mother's Day weekend.

reviews.author: Tim S.
reviews.description: it was nice to get to a vineyard that was hospitable and had darn good wine.  We continued through our drive in the countryside south of Austin to the next vineyard, which was Driftwood.  after pulling in and walking down the trail to the main house we got in line to do a tasting.  actually my gal got a tasting, was happy to try a full pour of the Cabernet they have.   While we waited I took in the rooms that we were in.  It was a homey vibe with lots of small things to buy and others to just look at. The tasting was pretty good, but I took my glass of wine outside to the edge of what seemed the property as it dropped off sharply down a hill. There was some chairs there to sit and look out over the valley and that's just what I did.  it is a beautiful spot to appreciate the views of the wine valley here.  I could see the vineyards crawling over the hills on the other side.   There was a gazebo a ways to my right with a couple people people enjoying there wine there.  They had some classic rock songs going on the sound system which added to the relaxed vibe. I would definitely recommend going, and for sure enjoy the view out back.

reviews.author: Brien M.
reviews.description: OMG. Yes. Really. OMG  The wines are really well made, and although I favored some over others, I see why they win so many medals.  The tasting isn't inexpensive but the pours are generous and the quality is superior to many other wineries.  The staff was knowledgeable and friendly. The terrace view is panoramic and spectacular. I'm so glad I stumbled upon this winery again when avoiding I-35 back to Austin from San Marcos.

reviews.author: Katie R.
reviews.description: Absolutely horrible experience this afternoon. My review is similar to those before me. There is a long list of rules and policies posted at the front. The one policy not listed is one you will be yelled at for violiting and practically chased out of the building for. We went in with the intention or purchasing a wine tasting experience. The woman behind the bar was rude, as others have mentioned, and did not tell us anything about the rules. We received our pour and stepped away to sit outside since, while the website boasts table tastings, there aren't any tables inside. We were yelled at in an absolutely abrasive manner by two woman behind the bar. We were then informed that we were not allowed to take our tastings outside and come back inside for the remaining pours. They stated: "it's just too busy to allow that on the weekends". There were four other people inside. Busy? I think not. There isn't a sign anywhere stating you must remain inside for the duration of the tasting. The women were so incredibly rude when referencing a policy that isn't stated anywhere and that we were completely unaware of. It was humiliating and aggressive. So many other wineries allow you to taste at your pace and sit wherever you'd like. This was not the case. We were so thrown off by such atrocious customer service that we settled on a bottle just to get out of the building.   Hours later I saw one of the same woman chase a woman out of the building while yelling "excuse me, excuse me" because the woman had violated some other unstated policy. Chasing after and yelling at paying customers does not invite a relaxing winery experience.   We are local to the area and are members of two other wineries. We would have been back but my opinion of this "estate" winery has been permanently soured. Don't aggressively yell at customers in front of other guests and certainly don't chase them around your property. We'll stick to welcoming wineries with better tasting wine like Duchman, Bell Springs, Wimberely Valley, and Fall Creek. If you're looking for a great Texas winery skip this place and head elsewhere.

reviews.author: Aneesa K.
reviews.description: Carol was our wine tasting experience .  Super friendly, it was a Tuesday so we had the place to ourselves pretty much.  Beautiful area you can see the vineyard from up top.  Dogs welcome, to s of land outside for the doggies yo play in.   We tasted award winning wine from TEXAS grapes!  I'll just bet that when the temperature is a bit WARMER, and the sunshine's one would have a memorable time relaxing and enjoying a bottle or two  Some nibbles you can purchase, not a whole lot the time we were there, remember it was TUESDAY

reviews.author: Mary Ann C.
reviews.description: We made a quick stop at this winery and enjoyed the view while having a glass of wine.  I chose a jammy Cabernet called Lone Star Cab that was perfect. They do wine tasting but I just opted for a glass of what I knew that I would enjoy.    The cafe was not open but they had items that paired well with wine.  I'm sure it is busy in the weekend.  The Cafe is small so get your food to go and enjoy one of the many cozy spots to view the vineyards.   The staff were very friendly and the store was very clean.  They have gifts as well.  If we were in town longer, We would have come back for lunch.    The road to the vineyard is gravel so drive slow.  Parking is free and plentiful.  Follow the signs as the vineyard is about a mile up from the main road.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Gorgeous property...Hill Country vistas at their finest.  Lovely people running the place, too. The wine was fine but definitely not the sole reason to visit, so make sure you have a couple places you're bopping around to in the area. Cute little tasting glasses and there's a shop for kitschy items featuring a lot of wine puns.    I do think the crowd skews a bit older, so better suited for entertaining folks than a bach party!

reviews.author: Hunter P.
reviews.description: No infant, children or teens? Seems like a great way to lose business... for sure won't be back here.

reviews.author: Anna Q.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery 25 minutes from Wimberly! We stopped by during 4th of July and was surprised there wasn't more of a crowd. Strict 21+ policy (many signs warning you to turn back if you aren't 21!) but the servers were so nice and kind. We did a wine tasting which was $20 for 6 samples of white, red, and sweet wine. You can also split the sampling between people, which I shared with a friend. Server (I think her name was Julie) was so sweet and knowledgeable about the wine flavors and gave us recommendations and some history of the flavors. Our favorite was the Starry Night, or the Orange Muscat wine! A bit disappointed they didn't give chocolates or nuts during a wine tasting and overall felt a bit rushed through the process as more people showed up, but it was still a unique experience.   The patio has a beautiful view of the orchard, which is why we came here versus other wineries in the area. Outdoor seating is plentiful, many round tables for larger groups too. Definitely would've spent a good half of day out here sipping wine if it wasn't for the rain. The Bistro (food/restaurant area) was closed because of Covid so eat before you arrive so you don't get hangry or wine drunk! ;)

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: We were recommended this place by a friend so we decided to check it out. It is in a very remote area which makes it nice. They are on a hill so that the outdoor seating has a great view.  We got 2 tastings and for the most part I enjoyed all of their wines. The Alamo Red was great and so was the Longhorn Red. My wife enjoyed the Chardonnay as well. The servers were very helpful and help guide us to their more popular wines.   We ended up buying a couple of bottles and really enjoyed the experience and the view. We plan on coming here again soon!

reviews.author: Marty S.
reviews.description: The place is beautiful. They service when you get there is rude.  Showed no interest in serving or helping. From the immediate negativity when you pull up telling you all the tjhongd you can't do. No children no sports no smoking no sports equipment. Then comes unfriendly support staff they have are a trip. It's a shame place has great views.

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: The wife and I tasted a flight of 6 wines: including the Rose, Cab, Red Blend, Merlot, Sangovese, and Syrah.  They were all simply awful swill. Everyone of the varietals lacked depth, character and complexity.  Everyone of the reds tasted blah, and I mean blah. They all lacked the distinctive aroma and notes that each of the grapes are known for.  The Rose  lacked any minerality that one would expect, and was as bad as the others.  The tasting room experience was as bad as the wines. The server had zero personality or character either.  We came away with the same thoughts as we have from other Hill Country Wineries.  They should not, nor should they be attempting to produce well known wines, and in fact do a terrible version of Cabs, Merlots, and Chards.  They should stick to Italian varietals, as well as a few others that might be better suited to the Texas climate, even though most people have no idea about those varietals. I suppose its just marketing to attract people in to the tasting room, and once they get toasted enough it no longer matters, since once the minds fogs, its just pour me another.

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Visiting in the area for the month and have returned several times for the award winning wines and lovely view. This place is awesome if you want to sit back and relax while taking in the gorgeous scenery. Gary, who works the later afternoon shift was kind, helpful and charming--a big step up from the ladies who we have had over the midday shift.

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: This was the second stop on our wine tour during our anniversary celebration. The ambiance is fantastic and is worth the visit to just get a bottle and enjoy the panoramic views.   Pro tip: they do not allow children, so know that before you go. I believe most of the poor reviews are about this fact, but if you are prepared beforehand it will help with the planning.

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: The Napa or Texas! It's totally different I know, I know however it's a sweet little place in Hill Country. Bring a few friends and drink a bottle outside under the tree shade. They have a nice bistro menu to pair with your wine.   Prices are really reasonable $25-50 a bottle. Nice selection of whites, reds, sweets. Enjoy.

reviews.author: Tayo F.
reviews.description: The view. You gotta see the view. Especially as the sun is going down. My picture doesn't so it justice but it it was amazing. There is of course the other great things like the food, the outdoor lights they put on when the sun goes down and the wine is pretty good too but none of that compares to the view. You'll know it when you see it.

reviews.author: Trina G.
reviews.description: What a nice surprise. Wonderful place and wonderful wine. Make sure you stop in for a tasting, glass or a bottle to take home.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Second time coming here and have not been disappointed. There was a small wait for wine tasting due to limited seating inside. They wipe down tables in between people and staff are all wearing mask. Plenty of space outside for proper social distancing and enjoying some wine. We grabbed a bottle and ate at the small restaurant they have there. Would recommend you make reservations if you want a view. Service was great and food was amazing. My favorite was the pizza, don't remember the name of it but it had honey on it and it was the perfect amount of sweetness. Never thought I would like a pizza with honey on it, now I can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: Driftwood winery was our first stop of wine tasting of the day. The view was what sold me. Perfect for pictures!! They have an outdoor sitting area where you can admire the views and the bottle that you order is brought to you by a server who wears a face shield and gloves.    My group ordered a bottle of the 2017 Newsom Cabernet Sauvignon and we were pleased with our choice. It was not dry like a Merlot but just right. This winery does not allow you to bring outside food only the food offered in their bistro outdoor facility. This was not an issue for us.   Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: This was the best winery of the 8 1/2 I made it to in Texas. All of the wines had a, well let's just say, flavor I am more accustomed to tasting. Prior to this place, everything I tasted was a mixture of sour fermented grapes. Not knocking Texas wines but they are just not my style. Maybe it needs an ice cube. Every wine here, ones that I tasted, is 100% Texan and done the way I think it is suppose to taste. Also, the view from the estate is beautiful. Very worth a stop for tasting and buying.

reviews.author: Matou P.
reviews.description: We have been club members here in the past, and really loved it. We went an 75 minutes out of our way to stop in for a tasting to see what peaked our interest in their current offerings. We loved that they have so much beautiful outdoor space. That is something that was always a major draw for us at Driftwood.   We called ahead, let them know we had a pup with us, and wanted to do a tasting. They told us to come on in. (It was a Monday and the place was very slow)  Upon arrival they told us they will only to tastings inside? What? In the era of COVID? As for the dog, they said one of us could do a tasting.   Between the lack of customer service, unfriendly attitude, and most importantly lack of outdoor tastings we will never bother to come back. WAY too many options with just as beautiful of grounds, equally great wines, safe tasting environment, and more importantly good customer service.

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: A great winery!  This is a beautiful winery and a great stop if you plan on visiting the other winery nearby or salt lick BBQ. Everyone is exceptionally helpful, they have a very comfortable tasting room, but I felt the tasting was way overpriced, so I decided to just buy a bottle of the Fall Creek Vineyards Tempranillo to drink while the rest of the group had their tasting.   They have an impressive operation and make some wonderful wines, definitely worth the stop. Cheers!

reviews.author: Chica B.
reviews.description: I visited this vineyards Dec 23 in the afternoon.  We were the only one in the winery.  We received good attention from the staff.  The wine tasting was really good.  Got to get one of the bottles for a present and an edged glass to keep.  I plan to visit Texas in a near future and this is one place that I plan to come back again. Wine first and bbq later.  Of all of the wines Mourvedre was our favorite.

reviews.author: Trenna H.
reviews.description: If you're looking to have a nice day trip from Austin, Fall Creek is a great spot.  I love coming out here for a wine tasting and enjoying the outside patio and having the vineyard to explore. The landscape is gorgeous and the staff are so knowledgeable and friendly.  Most importantly, the wine is delicious.    Pro tip- for an additional $8 you can add on an extra tasting of the ExTerra Tempranillo (usually a $100 bottle). It's amazing and a must try.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: The wine was amazing!!! Needless to say, we will be returning on our next trip to Austin. We are huge Cabernet fans and all of the wines were delicious. We took a few bottles home. When we tried the Tempranillo and it swept us off our feet. We have since found some of these wines in our local Houston Spec's.   The facility is clean and the grounds are well kept. The restrooms are also clean!!! Our host was simply amazing and went above and beyond to explain the process and enjoyed the discussion describing the notes we would/did experience. Really enjoyed the entire experience.

reviews.author: Nicolle M.
reviews.description: TLDR: relaxing atmosphere with nice white wines. Good on the spectrum of Texas wines but not on the level of French or Napa wines.  This is a great spot right across the street from salt lick. Parking lot is gravel but there's plenty of parking available. Hostess was extremely friendly and great conversation.  The wines themselves are good- we especially loved the Chardonnay and reserve wines. Based on Texas wineries, I have to say this is hands down one of the better vineyards. That being said, I have a deep love for Russian river valley wines (especially green valley pinots and Chardonnay's) and Texas grapes just don't measure up. Is that an unfair comparison? Probably.  Overall highly recommend visiting and supporting local. You'll want this on your wine tasting list of stops for sure, and best of all it's fairly close to Austin.

reviews.author: Kara G.
reviews.description: Fall Creek Vineyards totally exceeded our expectations! We have been super strict about staying home during COVID-19, but my #1 birthday wish was to get out ... in a safe way. With young children. My husband called Fall Creek ahead of time and was told that kids were allowed and that there was plenty of outdoor space.   We arrived around 2pm on a Wednesday afternoon and were greeted by a super friendly and knowledgeable gentleman. I wish I had grabbed his name, because he was seriously amazing. He let us know that a food purchase was required to be served on premise, which was not a problem at all because everything looked delicious (we chose a cheese platter), and gave us a wine menu as well.   We selected our own seats and were able to stay away from the party that came in after us. Our sommelier was so knowledgeable and provided everything in a COVID-19 safe way. He was also super sweet to our kids, even though our three year old was crushing crackers on the table (we cleaned up after him before we left but it was still so embarrassing).   All of the wines were delicious. We ended up leaving with their Tempranillo, their Sauvignon-blanc (vintners-selection) and two souvenir glasses.   We spent about an hour at Fall Creek, which ended up being the total highlight of my birthday, but could have spent more time there exploring their beautiful grounds  had we not had a dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: Texas has great wines.  A short drive from Austin (right across from Salt Lick) you can spend a few hours in the vineyard, sit in the patio, or stay inside. Of course, there is wine tasting and a variety of bottles for sale.  Fall Creek makes wines in all price points. From the quite good inexpensive wines to award-winning bottles for people who really know their reds. I am a fan of their Tempranillo.  If you are in Austin, it's worth a visit!

reviews.author: Elise G.
reviews.description: TL;DR: Couldn't recommend this more for a safe way to spend the day with your friends during (and even not during!) Covid.  My mom's in town so I wanted to take her to a winery semi-close to Austin but not too far away. ENTER: Fall Creek. It's been recommended to me by several friends so figured I'd check it out for myself:  PROS: Seriously the nicest staff in the world. Thank you Daniel! Plenty of socially distanced tables and chairs in LOTS of different areas of the winery A bottle of their amazing Sauvignon Blanc - $22! Great snacks to accompany (I got Pimento cheese) They had live music on a Saturday with a full band. swoon! Across the street from Salt Lick if you want foods  CONS: Seriously none. Couldn't have asked for a more perfect day. Can't wait to visit again!   Pro tip: go to Desert Door nearby for more fun. :)

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: FCV at Driftwood is a nice little winery, with seating indoors and out. When we were visiting, there was only one other guest present (midday Tuesday). As a personal recommendation, if you're trying to social distance, I would suggest visiting here only during the weekdays when it's less busy, otherwise it may seem too crowded since the place is on the smaller side.  The food menu mainly consists of cheese and snacks that go well with wine but it's a little overpriced. The staff was nice but they were just there for the most part, nothing more to enhance our experience.   3/5 staff/service 4/5 nicely decorated interior and exterior 5/5 with the right company

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Good stop on your wine tour! We opted for two full glasses of their most standout wines and although it was much more expensive wine than I'm used to, we did get a generous pour. The backyard terrace is peaceful and has many seating options. I would've loved to see an option where you could do a wine tasting outdoors, perhaps the same way you order a beer flight. I saw this because wine tastings are only offered inside.

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: We didn't care for this place that much. The dining/patio area was nice but seemed like some of it was off limits (maybe party rooms). Wine offering was limited. We had a Chardonnay, Tempranillo and a Lescalo. They were just OK but it was the end of our day before heading to Salt Lick so that could have had an impact. One visit here was enough for us.

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: The wine here is really delicious. They are only doing tastings inside. The tasting is a preset menu. You can order a glass and get food outside afterwards. The service is great and our waitress was very friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Me Y.
reviews.description: Entrance is nice yet when you go to the back it needs a little tending. Table tops were messy, landscaping needs a little touch up, I'm hoping it was just a little neglect we might try it again later.

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: After 3 months of quarantine, two of us ventured out for a bff day of wine and views. Our 2nd stop was Falls Creek....it was so pretty with perfect sunny weather and enough seating inside and out. Covid is still among us so they offer hand santizers but you bring your own mask. Most patrons didn't have on of course once they had their wine in hand.   We opted to sit outdoors. Tables are 3-4 ft apart in some spots so choose within your comfort zone for social distancing. We grabbed a quick glass of wine and made our way to the next stop.   Looking forward to returning with the hubby this summer.

reviews.author: Tina M.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our tasting experience here! We will be back. Knowledgeable and gracious, this winery is a must do for anyone in the area that wants an amazing wine tasting experience.

reviews.author: Christina R.
reviews.description: Went to Fall Creek for a wine tasting prior to dinner at Salt Lick.  We were seated in the indoor patio which was extremely warm.  No water was offered.  We requested the tasting - 5 wines that are pre-selected, you aren't able to choose.  After the second (extremely small) pour, we had to request water.  Decided to order a couple of apps for the group..we were brought store made hummus and pimento cheese - still in the plastic container, propped on a plate with a wrapped package of crackers.  Had to request small plates, which seemed to surprise our server.  By the end of the tasting we were all sweating as the sun was beating down on us and there seemed to be no AC. The wines were okay, but the experience and service could have been much better.  I wouldn't return.

reviews.author: Roy C.
reviews.description: Wine tasting was $20 for 5 small pours.  Can't select wines to try, only had 5 bottles open and only one was what I would have wanted.  Food prices were also high.  Place was fairly full but I don't know why.  Wines we tasted were fair at best.  Too many good one in the area to waste your time here.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This vineyard was a delightful second stop on our day drinking in the Driftwood area. The wine picked by my group was light , refreshing and the perfect compliment to have after we had made a lunch stop at a brisket place.
